## About the sports management major  Sports management promotes, encourages, and supports athletic participation for recreational, educational, and professional sports organizations, as well as individual and team athletic events and competitions that draw spectators. You'll learn the art of promoting, selling, and facility and event management. You'll earn a general business minor or certificate in this degree program. Internship opportunities are available both locally and regionally.  Skills and abilities this major develops: communication, marketing, sales, promotions, and team building.  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Community engagement The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.](https://shhs.iupui.edu/community/index.html)   #### Community engagement  The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.  [Professional work experience Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.  [Life–Health Sciences Internship Program LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.](https://lhsi.iupui.edu/)   #### Life–Health Sciences Internship Program  LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of event managers is projected to grow 18% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 16,600 openings for meeting, convention, and event planners are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Health and Human Science graduates was $44,206, and the median salary was $38,000.  The national median annual salary for event managers was $49,470 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Sports management majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  E Enterprising  S Social  R Realistic  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [School of Health and Human Sciences](https://shhs.iupui.edu/)  School of Health and Human Sciences  [North American Society for Sport Management](https://nassm.org/)  North American Society for Sport Management  [Teamwork Online](https://www.teamworkonline.com/)  Teamwork Online   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Public policy   ### O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs  Students will study the policymaking process, law and public policy, performance measurement and program evaluation, government finance and budgets, management, leadership and ethics, history, social sciences, natural sciences, communications, and community and metropolitan development. Graduates often go on to law school or directly into positions in government or government relations, but many career paths are available with this degree.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Policy studies   #### Major information  Public policy  [Public policy](https://oneill.iupui.edu/academics/undergrad-degrees/policy-studies.html)   #### Get admitted to the O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs   ##### Admission requirements   ##### Home page  [O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs](https://oneill.iupui.edu/index.html)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## About the furniture design major  Studying fine arts at in the Herron School of Art and Design is your first step in building a meaningful and influential career in art and design. You'll study the historical development of art as a social and intellectual phenomenon. You'll also learn about art firsthand with Indianapolis community partners and will find opportunities and resources to bring your artistic concepts to fruition. All majors spend the first year building foundational skills. Fine arts majors include: ceramics, drawing and illustration, furniture design, painting, photography, printmaking, and sculpture.  Skills and abilities the major develops: understanding historical contexts, analysis, fine arts skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.  [Career services Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Career services  Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni. ## About the paramedic science major  Emergency medical technicians (EMTs), both basic and paramedic, care for people at the scene of emergencies and transport them to hospitals or other health care institutions. They determine the nature and the extent of victims’ medical and trauma-related emergencies and provide initial emergency care. EMT paramedics administer medications, supply intravenous therapy, perform heart monitoring, and provide other lifesaving interventions for the victims of acute illness or injury until they reach a medical facility.  Skills and abilities this major develops: critical thinking, problem solving, oral communication, teamwork, cultural competency, knowledge of human anatomy and physiology, professionalism, and emergency management.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Job shadow Shadowing a professional while they’re on the job is valuable for exploring careers. Some of the health professions programs also require observation hours as part of the application process.](https://hls.iupui.edu/plan/get-experience/index.html)   #### Job shadow  Shadowing a professional while they’re on the job is valuable for exploring careers. ## Majors and careers for conventional interests   ### For data and real people  Majors and careers can be clustered into six broad interest areas that correspond to six different personality types. Based on the research of Dr. John Holland, this clustering system provides a preliminary way to identify undergraduate majors and careers that might be a satisfying fit for you. Because personality, majors, and careers are too complex to be described by a single interest theme, you will see that the lists below have a three-letter code to more accurately describe majors and careers using a combination of related interests (in order of importance). This “conventional” page reflects the interest cluster that ranks the “C” theme first, but be sure to review the other five clusters to see if any of those themes (A, I, S, R, E) are more descriptive of your interests.   ### Am I conventional?  Check off your interests, values, abilities, and qualities to find out.  These are characteristics of the conventional type. Conventional people are practical, well controlled, sociable, conservative, prefer structured tasks, and prefer conformity. They like to work with data, have clerical or numerical ability, and are very attentive to detail. If this sounds like you, read on. If not, try one of the other five interest clusters.   ### Conventional majors  The following is a small sample of majors a conventional person might find interesting.  [Accounting](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ETutECKU_RBLjC0Eiy77UcsBzsEROyl4KeI-y4ZvVgNWaQ?e=LTZj91)  [Health Services Management](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ETpxjTiH2-NMmm6A9TICVm4B2a0GnFiUy7U7RPaG5oXKng?e=VumcjQ)  [Cytotechnology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EQOBR95ZCk5KkFuZekNxPSIBaELF_nkRnxCoRX3DZEYwzg?e=op7YIM)  [Human Resource Management](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EfEz7zpSgk9Fk8ArNj8RtzkBSM4sY5XiGleYoDQxOzWVgg?e=MnMTN9)  [Finance](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EZqzLx9xO0hJmPckyxtN1q0BrEXuYDtkiIm7mY38km9GZA?e=LxXIks)  [Social Work](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EdHZmnla28JAtaW2kTq_KOgBbfoJjKg9K-m3sys8DcJmww?e=4QxKob)  [Forensic and Investigative Science](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EaEi2qBpaPxFlDIsv1K_OtcBrR7L1uWbp2r75uNRAqd7fA?e=5UZnZa)  [Tourism](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ee2m-zDqTRVKvP0NNPd5aCYBMdg_NhzYaeTaZ5qT_7OCFQ?e=uEGUoK)  [Health Information Administration](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EbyBwT_wnlhKgSZsiBOy42YBEy0u_ev0lfjw9qzXcBzurA?e=e1M7JS)   ### Conventional careers  Following is a small sample of careers a conventional person might choose.   ### Selecting a conventional major and career  Selecting a major and career is a very involved process, requiring careful evaluation of yourself as well as academic and occupational information. No single questionnaire, assessment, or person can tell you what you should pursue. In order to make the best choices, it is important to consider your unique combination of interests, values, abilities, personality, and experiences.  Keep in mind that majors and careers can accommodate a wide range of interests; an exact fit is not necessary for academic and career satisfaction. The majors and careers above are suggested only as starting points for your exploration. Specific major and career decisions can be discussed in more detail with your academic advisor or career counselor.   ### More information on careers and advising  [Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI](http://www.iupui.edu/academic/schoolsdepts.htm)  Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI  Check sheets for each IUPUI major  [Course descriptions for IUPUI](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/)  Course descriptions for IUPUI  What can I do with a major I choose? ## Get to know our first-gen staff  Our First-Generation Celebration is a time to celebrate our first-generation students! The campuswide celebration will be on Tuesday, November 8, from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., in the Campus Center TV Lounge.  Get to know some of the Academic and Career Development (ACD) staff that are first-gen, too!   ### Dee Alderman  Career Consultant, STEM  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? Balance your schedule so you're not taking all of the classes that challenge you at one time. Also make sure you utilize the resources available to you on campus! Who, or what, was your greatest support that helped you transition to college? The offices and support mechanisms on campus. I was also a member of TRIO Student Support Services, and they were a great resource as well. I would tell a first-generation student to get involved both with academic supports and with student life. There is so much available on campus to help you be successful! What was your fondest memory of college? Honestly, when I acclimated to campus and got involved, I would see faces I knew who knew me. It was great feeling like I belonged on campus. It was great feeling like I belonged on campus.   ### River Garrett  Student Success Advisor, AHHS  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? It is 110% okay to ask questions—even the ones you think "should" be obvious; our obvious is different than others, and that's okay. You're already taking a huge step in being the first, and it's okay to not have all the answers. Who, or what, was your greatest support that helped you transition to college? Finding my people. I was introduced to my best friend by happenstance through friends I made in my FYS, and we were inseparable. I truly don't know that I would have made it without her cheering me on and being there to help me—her dad was an alum of our school, so she had a lot of the answers to questions I had. What was your fondest memory of college? I have so many, but if I had to pick one, it'd be a finals tradition my best friend and I had: a Taco Bell 12-pack snuck into the library to munch on the entire day while we studied and did projects. We'd stay in that freezing library for 12 hours and trudge across campus at 2 a.m. to crash in bed!  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? We'd stay in that freezing library for 12 hours and trudge across campus at 2 a.m. to crash in bed!   ### Heather Long  Student Success Advisor, STEM  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? Ask ALL the questions. This transition into something new can feel very overwhelming, and there are going to be things that you encounter that you never even thought to ask about before. Don't ever hesitate to reach out to your advisor or a professor if you need some extra guidance. That's what they're here for! Who, or what, was your greatest support that helped you transition to college? My husband. I received some well-meaning, but admittedly bad advice, when I first transitioned from high school to college. I had no one I could really turn to for help at that time. When I returned to school as an adult learner, my husband really helped walk me through what I needed to do, and it made all the difference. What was your fondest memory of college? Finally finding a major that really fit who I was and what I was passionate about. Once I discovered this, so many other pieces started to fall into place! Thankfully, I had a wonderful advisor who helped guide me and made sure I was on the right track.  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? Ask ALL the questions. Thankfully, I had a wonderful advisor who helped guide me and made sure I was on the right track.   ### Jessa Trimble  Director of Professional Development and HLSAC  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? Treat everything as a learning opportunity. Things might not go as planned or might be more difficult that you were prepared for, but you could really learn something from those experiences. Who, or what, was your greatest support that helped you transition to college? My roommate and my advisor. As someone who was really shy, my outgoing roommate taught me to just ask questions and figure it out. Don't know the lingo? Ask someone what that abbreviation or acronym means. Don't know how to get to that class? Leave 10 minutes earlier than you would have and figure it out. My advisor was more gentle and encouraging—he taught me how to understand degree plans, communicate with my instructors, and make the most out of the "extras" in college, like internships, colloquial classes, and picking minors. What was your fondest memory of college? I don't know that I could pick just one. I think what I look back at most fondly from college are the times I spent with friends I still have today. Sure, I learned a lot and college is what prepared me for what I do now, but none of that would mean much if I hadn't met all of the amazing people I did! Sure, I learned a lot and college is what prepared me for what I do now, but none of that would mean much if I hadn't met all of the amazing people I did!   ### Chris Maroldo  Director of Academic Success  What advice do you have for other first-gen students? Join study groups when possible. It's amazing how much more you can learn by discussing homework or prepping for tests with your peers. I remember my first few months as a freshman. I thought I was one of the only ones who didn't understand some of the concepts in my intro to sociology course. So rather than embarrass myself by raising my hand, I kept quiet. I later found out when I joined a study group that no one else understood the same things I didn't! We worked on those problems together and did well on the next few tests. Don't be shy about asking your instructors, your advisor, and even some of the students in your classes for help when you need assistance. Who, or what, was your greatest support that helped you transition to college? I was a year behind my best friend in high school. He went to college before I did. When he came home for the holidays, he encouraged me to apply to the same school. We were both musicians and wanted to continue playing in our band, so I ended up where he was. It was much easier for me to make friends when I knew one already. We hung around the same people, and the band was playing more and more, so the beginning of my college experience was based on a gut feeling that I should go where my friend was. That's probably not the best way to choose a school, but for me it worked. What was your fondest memory of college? This will sound a bit strange, but my fondest memory was getting academically dismissed from my college. What that allowed me to do was to take a break from the rigors of academia and took a couple of semesters off to play in the band, work full time, and come to the realization that I was not going to be a rock star and that I'd better get my degree first. So after I was mentally ready to tackle college again, I picked the major that felt the best for me (teaching), buckled down, and graduated. The second fondest memory? Going back to school to get a master's degree. Those decisions ultimately led me on a long and winding path to IUPUI and becoming one of the directors in our office. ## About the Africana studies major  Africana studies is an interdisciplinary approach to understand the historical, political, and cultural experiences of people of Africa and African descent across the globe. You'll develop your own unique perspective of justice, freedom, and equality.  The major allows students to think critically about the function of race within individuals, institutions, and society while gaining an awareness of social justice issues. For this major, you'll choose a concentration in one of three areas: Africa, Caribbean and Latin America, or North America.  Skill and abilities this major develops : cultural competency, writing, public speaking, critical thinking, research, and teamwork (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2017).  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. ## About the construction management major  The construction management major provides you with a strong foundational knowledge in the areas of construction contract administration and specifications, construction field operations, construction costs and bidding, construction scheduling and project control, construction law and ethics, construction safety and inspection, construction project monitoring and control, and construction project management. Additional coursework includes mathematics, sciences, economics, technical writing, oral communications, and business (Purdue School of Engineering and Technology, 2019). Skills and abilities the major develops: construction management, business management, collaboration, project management, cost and product estimation, decision-making and leadership skills, compliance with regulations, and analytical and time-management skills.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website. ## About the medical humanities and health studies major  The medical humanities and health studies major prepares you to understand the broader role and determinants of health and medicine in today’s world. Humanities courses raise questions of how human beings deal with health, medical intervention, illness, and death. You'll gain insight into the social, economic, and cultural contexts of health, illness, and health care. This degree will prepare you for a wide array of career paths.  Skills and abilities this major develops: effective communication, health care knowledge, public speaking, research, and problem solving (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## About the computer engineering major  Computer engineering teaches you how to apply mathematical and scientific principles to the development, design, and evaluation of computer hardware and software systems and related equipment and processes.  A strong foundation in basic computer engineering subjects, physics, and mathematics is required, as well as specific courses related to computers, electronics, applied physics, and software development. Combine your expertise with hardware, analytical skills, and software knowledge to design computer systems, networks, software, and operating systems in the future.  Skills and abilities this major develops: analytical and critical thinking skills, problem-solving skills, collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, detail orientation, and communication skills.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website. ## About the photography major  Studying fine arts at IUPUI in the Herron School of Art and Design is your first step in building a meaningful and influential career in art and design. You'll study the historical development of art as a social and intellectual phenomenon. You'll also learn about art firsthand with Indianapolis community partners and will find opportunities and resources to bring your artistic concepts to fruition.  All majors spend the first year building foundational skills. Fine arts majors include: ceramics, drawing and illustration, furniture design, painting, photography, printmaking, and sculpture.  Skills and abilities the major develops: understanding historical contexts, analysis, fine arts skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## Sociology   ### School of Liberal Arts  Human beings are social animals. We live in groups and do most things with other people. Much of what we think, say, and do is influenced by what others expect of us and by how others treat us. Sociologists study the patterns of interaction between people in all sorts of settings—at work, at play, at home, etc. They try to clarify what is going on, what lies behind it, what is likely to come from it, and what might be done differently. Their theories and research findings can provide insights into processes and events that affect our everyday lives.  Perhaps you have wondered why some families get along fine while others seem mired in problems, why some people get involved in criminal careers while others resist temptations, why some companies are much more productive than others, or why some governmental programs succeed while others backfire. These are the kinds of issues sociologists look into in systematic ways.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Physics   ### School of Science  All physics majors study the foundations of the field: classical mechanics, classical electrodynamics, quantum mechanics, relativity, and statistical physics. They also learn a great deal of mathematics (more than is required for a minor) and have a year of chemistry. Depending on individual career goals, physics majors may also take additional courses in chemistry and biology, electrical or mechanical engineering, or physics and mathematics.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Physics   #### Major information  Physics  [Physics](https://science.iupui.edu/academics/areas-of-study/physics.html)   #### Get admitted to the School of Science   ##### Admission by certification  Admission for physics  [Admission for physics](https://science.iupui.edu/admissions/apply/index.html)   ##### Home page  School of Science  [School of Science](http://science.iupui.edu/)   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

# Wendy Moreno  Peer Advisor  Did you ever change your major? I changed my major so many times! From mathematics education to dental hygiene to health services management.  Work or involvement experience while at IUPUI: Lead volunteer at Paws Pantry.  Advice to students: You will find what you love! I was so nervous coming into college, thinking that I had made the wrong decision about my major and that I wouldn't be able to change it. Things happen and interests change, but you will find your passion! It might take your first couple of semesters, but if you are nervous about where you are, don't be. Everything will work out, and there are a ton of resources that will help you find your passion.  Brief bio : I am from Greenwood, Indiana, and I love volunteering, spending time with my friends and family, and going for walks to clear my mind. After graduating from IUPUI, I hope to work in a small health care clinic as a manager.

## Learn more about our successful students  There are more than 19,000 undergraduate students at IUPUI, each with a unique background and experience. Hearing other students’ stories and their strategies for success can help in navigating and making the most of your college career. Highlighted below are a few of the many successful IUPUI students.   ### December 2019—Birdie Ratliff  This month we're celebrating a former exploratory major and University College student, Birdie Ratliff!   ### Why Birdie chose to begin as exploratory  Birdie is a junior who started at IUPUI as an exploratory major. She wanted to attend IUPUI because it wasn't too far from family, but also not too close. Since she was unsure what she wanted to major in, the advisors at orientation recommended exploratory. This was right for her because she was able to explore different fields and majors to determine which major best suited her.   ### How Birdie discovered her major  Birdie took many different courses during her freshman and sophomore years before changing her major. She discovered what courses and fields she liked and disliked.  After frequent meetings with the University College exploratory advisors, Birdie discovered sustainable management and policy. She is very eco-friendly and cares about recycling and saving the planet, so she felt like this could be the perfect major. Some careers she’s considering include working for the U.S. National Parks Service or for city parks. She even has an internship with Keeping Indianapolis Beautiful where she will help with community gardens and tree plantings.   ### Birdie's strategies for success  Birdie’s main strategies for success are time management and prioritization. Planning out coursework and study time helps with accomplishing important assignments and tasks on time. She also attends study groups regularly for her courses. Hearing other people’s perspectives and learning processes can help with better understanding of content.   ### Birdie's advice for exploratory students  Birdie suggests meeting with the University College exploratory advisors frequently because they are very helpful with the exploration of majors and even with discovering majors you might not know exist.  A common misconception of starting as an exploratory major is that you won’t finish on time; however, Birdie didn’t change her major to sustainable management and policy until the end of her sophomore year and has the opportunity to graduate a semester early. Don’t be scared to explore majors if you’re not sure what you want to do yet. Birdie even said, “I don’t think I would have found my major if I didn’t do exploratory.”   ### October 2019—Chica Ketterman  In celebration of National Transfer Appreciation Week, October 21–25, we're celebrating transfer student and former University College student, Chica Ketterman!   ### Why Chica transferred to IUPUI  Chica is a sophomore who transferred to IUPUI in 2018 from Los Angeles Valley College, which is located in the San Fernando Valley, California. She also attended an art school in California before discovering her passion for science and engineering.  Chica moved to Shelbyville, Indiana, to work in the engineering field. Previously living in Indiana and having her mom living here helped make the transition less difficult. She came to IUPUI to earn a degree in mechanical engineering technology so she can continue her engineering career.   ### How Chica discovered her major  When Chica attended Los Angeles Valley College, she was majoring in physics. However, after taking some courses and exploring career options, she felt that physics was too broad of a major and couldn’t see herself finding a career that she would be passionate about.  When Chica moved to Indiana, she starting working in the engineering field and was able to visualize herself continuing this career. She came to IUPUI wanting to graduate with a mechanical engineering technology degree. Her long-term goal is to relocate to another state and work from home doing freelance engineering.   ### Chica's strategies for success  The biggest challenge Chica faced was working full time while taking classes full time. She admits that she is still working on her academic strategies, but that prioritization has been the most helpful. Chica's University College academic advisor, Rachael Carmichael, helped Chica work on her prioritization and time management skills. She also believes that having a good support system, like her mom and friends, is very important.   ### Chica's advice to new transfer students  A lot of the advice students hear is to get involved, but this can be very difficult for those who work full time. Chica’s advice for new IUPUI transfer students is “don’t be afraid to ask questions and network by making friends with motivated students and teachers.”

## About the law in liberal arts major  The law in liberal arts major is designed to prepare you for a career as a paralegal in the legal profession. You'll learn practical legal skills, as well as a background in legal concepts, so that you can obtain jobs quickly in this rapidly expanding profession. This program prepares you specifically for paralegal positions, but will also provide foundational knowledge of law.  Skills and abilities this major develops : critical thinking, communicating effectively in a legal environment, and understanding legal principles (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2019).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.  [Career services The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/cdo/)   #### Career services  The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.  [Study abroad Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of paralegals and legal assistants is projected to grow 14% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 45,800 openings for paralegals and legal assistants are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for liberal arts graduates with a bachelor's degree was $43,722, and the median salary was $38,900.  The national median salary for paralegals and legal assistants was $56,230 in May 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Law in liberal arts majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  C Conventional  I Investigative  E Enterprising   ### Where to get more information  [IU School of Liberal Arts](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/)  IU School of Liberal Arts  [American Bar Association](https://www.americanbar.org/)  American Bar Association  [National Federation of Paralegals](https://www.paralegals.org/)  National Federation of Paralegals   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Spanish   ### School of Liberal Arts  The Spanish program at IUPUI assists students in achieving proficiency in the Spanish language and helps them develop an understanding of and appreciation for the wide range of Hispanic cultural, literary, and linguistic manifestations. The Spanish program offers introductory and advanced instruction in language, linguistics, culture and civilization, literature, and applied language studies.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Finance   ### Kelley School of Business  Finance may start on a spreadsheet, but the art of understanding and interpreting how individuals and corporations allocate their assets over time and under uncertain economic conditions goes well beyond the confines of calculations. Think of finance as data-driven decision making. Where others just see numbers, financial advisors, brokers, business analysts, and chief financial officers see a blueprint to building a strong bottom line.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Degree planning information  Current international dimension offerings may be found in your pre-business student Canvas site.   #### Major-career connections  Finance   #### Get admitted to the Kelley School of Business   ##### Admission by certification  Current IUPUI students no longer have to submit an application to be admitted from University College to the Kelley School of Business Undergraduate Program. You'll be notified when the admission requirements are met. To certify into the Kelley School of Business from University College, you'll need to meet one of the sets of admission criteria . You'll be certified as soon as you meet either set of criteria.  [admission criteria](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EcwEAw_wtUVLuODPWHp7WM4Bojo7dz43egO1kg2giCZk9A?e=TmKTI6)   ##### Certification process   ##### Home pages  [Kelley School of Business](https://kelley.iupui.edu/)  [Kelley—majors information](http://kelley.iupui.edu/undergrad/academics/majors/)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management. ## Economics   ### School of Liberal Arts  The economics major has the option of pursuing a general track or a quantitative track. The general track provides a firm grounding in economic theory and exposure to problems and techniques the student is likely to encounter in a business, nonprofit, or governmental agency environment. The quantitative track supplements the general track with extensive training in mathematical and statistical techniques required for graduate coursework. This track is also recommended for those students who prefer a more quantitative approach to problem solving.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. ## Majors and careers for artistic interests   ### For idea creators  Majors and careers can be clustered into six broad interest areas that correspond to six different personality types. Based on the research of Dr. John Holland, this clustering system provides a preliminary way to identify undergraduate majors and careers that might be a satisfying fit for you. Because personality, majors, and careers are too complex to be described by a single interest theme, you will see that the lists below have a three-letter code to more accurately describe majors and careers using a combination of related interests (in order of importance). This “artistic” page reflects the interest cluster that ranks the “A” theme first, but be sure to review the other five clusters to see if any of those themes (R, I, S, C, E) are more descriptive of your interests.   ### Am I artistic?  Check off your interests, values, abilities, and qualities to find out.  These are characteristics of the artistic type. Artistic people are creative, independent, expressive, imaginative, original, and intuitive. They like to compose, write, appreciate the arts, create, imagine, and generate new ideas. If this sounds like you, read on. If not, try one of the other five interest clusters.   ### Artistic majors  The following is a small sample of majors an artistic person might find interesting.  [English](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVJdbMf9rQRKhyYR3LR76LoBhKsNYU3H5GyFOm5UE06kQA?e=qjwdjE)  [Interior Design Technology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EaxgYiJqBupEpjePfj1lORgB3tk7x44CZeQMQps9tyYuog?e=IWgUYo)  [Journalism](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EQC6ijFYJ-5MtPg-00ML0NMBAZSCotCkn_bxeuT5M_HkEQ?e=8eOjXF)  [Media Arts and Sciences](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ERU_0ZbsIghCjTKyz7AROxEBxAqlY8DjGKjnDUFLguQkjA?e=v5ylpa)  [Painting](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ea2QNKpE0y1Ku99KbHT3jQYBr6CXzrSBfkOwyoWXX7jItQ?e=SaqUCO)  [Philosophy](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVViYUJwMyxLi8XCJ-QFKtAB-4JkMYChddqgxzWvmXAM5w?e=U5jT4w)  [Photography](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ea2QNKpE0y1Ku99KbHT3jQYBr6CXzrSBfkOwyoWXX7jItQ?e=SaqUCO)  [Printmaking](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ea2QNKpE0y1Ku99KbHT3jQYBr6CXzrSBfkOwyoWXX7jItQ?e=SaqUCO)  [Sculpture](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ea2QNKpE0y1Ku99KbHT3jQYBr6CXzrSBfkOwyoWXX7jItQ?e=SaqUCO)  [Visual Communication Design](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EXWKzYg3QidLrSpCBBJiO9EBJBLa5nClIAIwpWoRP6h9tg?e=ffItci)   ### Artistic careers  Following is a small sample of careers an artistic person might choose:   ### Selecting an artistic major and career  Selecting a major and career is a very involved process, requiring careful evaluation of yourself as well as academic and occupational information. No single questionnaire, assessment, or person can tell you what you should pursue. In order to make the best choices, it is important to consider your unique combination of interests, values, abilities, personality, and experiences.  Keep in mind that majors and careers can accommodate a wide range of interests; an exact fit is not necessary for academic and career satisfaction. The majors and careers above are suggested only as starting points for your exploration. Specific major and career decisions can be discussed in more detail with your academic advisor or career counselor.   ### More information on careers and advising  [Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI](http://www.iupui.edu/academic/schoolsdepts.htm)  Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI  Check sheets for each IUPUI major  [Course descriptions for IUPUI](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/)  Course descriptions for IUPUI  What can I do with a major I choose? # Kinsey C Ashworth  Student Success Advisor, STEM Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students: Ask a lot of questions. Take notes on meetings (outside of class!). Explore yourself and be willing to allow changes to your future plans. Don't compare yourself to your classmates/friends. Network in your classes—your classmates and professors are your future colleagues.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why ?: I would have loved to be a biomedical engineering major. Math has never clicked for me, but if it did, I would love to be an engineer in the medical field and create new products to help people.  Biography : I have lived in four different states (Indiana, Kansas, Florida, and South Carolina), but I grew up in Indianapolis, Indiana. I attended Franklin Central High School, but ended up moving to Hays, Kansas, for my final year of high school, so I am a Hays High School graduate. I use my degree in history to my advantage in trivia competitions. I have a ragdoll cat named after King Henry VIII. I am a proud aunt to my nieces and nephew, and you will see them all over my office. I am looking forward to serving IUPUI students!

## Printable major-career worksheets  Career development is an important aspect of your experience at IUPUI. When you can articulate your values, interests, personality, and skills in a detailed way and relate those to the world of work, you become a more engaged and successful student. Academic and Career Development within University College helps guide you to your best-fit major and subsequent career path.  Nine major-career resource guides below help you process who you are, learn how to get pertinent experiences to confirm your major and career choices, and gain valuable experiences for marketability upon graduation.  [#1 Interest code booklet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ET0ZMGp8A3FPiGeG3i004iQBBUn1gMvOLGf6EJttVrmBug?e=SmCtX1)  [IUPUI Majors and interest code sheet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EY_9MIr7qHFFt-8fTYehBEoBMjKGjyK-cqP8lvIjG7VMvg?e=XCEKTu)  [#2 FOCUS](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EcDny3mFzZtCjYwzJJ4HkBQBkTr4GGC5F_EhqrY-06LUjg?e=K6diHE)  [#3 Major-career connection sheets](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EUjC1NhAMb1CikfebFeYWRwBHf6xd6-glPMD0cKlS_n-9Q?e=CazqSD)  [#4 Candid Career](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EWrUASXR78JAgUatRBAK4eABV0-opbY6xjKpfHUT-P7bjQ?e=7rjwZF)  [#5 O*NET](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EdCmhGG6cX1IiHjN-5BPQa4BeXhXZIMsOBkZxYnpEYvTrw?e=HvDUe3)  [#6 Informational interviewing](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ESaSAdXEVPJNhkshjJHswF4BEKnOf5Caz7O3zKievo7K6Q?e=gMbTD8)  [#7 Parallel planning](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ea-IQkhh9SpBuindqacC3VwBXqCTy8v4_oqruJ1vvRyVMA?e=yAF51w)  [#8 Major and career exploration event](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVFBVCC_yt5HgRyhI-dzgcoB4EUHioemkP3hd_V-5s9kYw?e=wYxutU)  If you have questions or need a resource in an accessible format, please contact Mike Slocum .

## Services and hours   ### We are here to help  Academic and Career Development can help you with:   ### Connect with our office  Email: advising@iupui.edu Phone: (317) 274-4856 Location: Taylor Hall (UC) 3004  Office hours (in-person and virtual services):  Monday, August 7, through Friday, May 10  Appointments: Virtual and in-person appointments are available. Appointments for all services with a student success advisor or career consultant are available when the office is open and at varying times in the evenings or weekends. You can schedule an appointment through the Student Appointment Scheduler (SAS) or by calling the office.  Schedule an appointment  [Schedule an appointment](https://one.iu.edu/task/iu/student-appointment-scheduler)  Drop-in advising : Meet quickly with a peer advisor for answers to simple questions about your degree, campus resources, completion of a required form, or changes to your current class schedule. Please note that record holds cannot be cleared during a drop-in meeting. If an issue warrants a more in-depth conversation, you may be asked to schedule an appointment with an advisor.  * Refer to the schedule below for:  Access drop-ins virtually  [Access drop-ins virtually](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  Open advising: On occasion, ACD will offer open advising in which all services are available, including clearing record holds. No appointment is needed, and you will be seen in the order of your arrival.  * Refer to the schedule below for:  Access open advising virtually  [Access open advising virtually](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)   ### Holiday hours and adjusted services  Occasionally, we need to adjust office hours and services. Find out when our holiday and adjusted office hours and services are.   #### Fall 2023  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)  [virtual](https://iu.zoom.us/my/advising)   ### Explore more services  Need to return to our main websites? # Laura Masterson  Managing Director  [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/laura-masterson-51082034/)  Pronouns : she/her/hers  Education  Professional Experience:  Advice to Students:  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: Environmental science. I love science and read a ton of nonfiction about environmental issues and the evolving knowledge base that informs the discipline.  Biography: I grew up in Evansville, Indiana, in the southwestern part of the state, went to college in northern Indiana, and now call Indy my home. When I’m not working, I’m spending as much time as possible outside. Hobbies I enjoy include woodworking, hiking, trail biking, kayaking, and copious amounts of reading. More than anything, I enjoy watching my kids grow into amazing people and traveling to new places. I have four chickens, who provide us many laughs and lots of eggs. My favorite place on campus is the Magnolia Courtyard between Taylor Hall and the Education Building.

## About the world languages and cultures major  The world languages and cultures major focuses on general knowledge of a country, its language, history, culture, political and economic systems, and literature.  As a student, you'll gain skills in:  This major will help you learn the multiple connections between language, culture, and applications to other disciplines. IUPUI offers degrees and translation studies certificates in French, German, and Spanish, as well as courses in Arabic, Japanese, Chinese, and classic languages (e.g., Greek, Latin).  Skills and abilities this major develops: cultural competency, foreign language, public speaking, critical thinking, and communication (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2018).  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.  [Career services The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/cdo/)   #### Career services  The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.  [Study abroad Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of interpreters and translators is projected to grow 20% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 9,200 openings for interpreters and translators are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for the School of Liberal Arts graduates was $44,2006, and the median salary was $38,000 .  The national median annual salary for interpreters and translators was $49,110 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022). ## About the health sciences major  The Department of Health Sciences offers a variety of academic programs for students, both those seeking employment directly out of the undergraduate program and those intending to pursue graduate or professional study. Students pursuing the health sciences major will have the opportunity to pursue specialty certificates in gerontology, rehabilitation and disability studies, or nutrition.  Studies and abilities this major develops : communication skills, active listening skills, attention to detail, knowledge of business and legal considerations in health care, and a foundation in social sciences.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Community engagement The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.](https://shhs.iupui.edu/community/index.html)   #### Community engagement  The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.  [Professional work experience Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.  [Life–Health Sciences Internship Program LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.](https://lhsi.iupui.edu/)   #### Life–Health Sciences Internship Program  LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of medical and health services managers is projected to grow 28% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 56,600 openings for medical and health services managers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for health sciences B.S. graduates was $37,897, and the median salary was $40,000.  The national median annual salary for medical and health services managers was $101,340 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Health sciences majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These career options require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  C Conventional  I Investigative   ### Where to get more information  [School of Health and Human Sciences](https://shhs.iupui.edu/)  School of Health and Human Sciences  [Indiana Department of Health](https://www.in.gov/health/)  Indiana Department of Health  [Health and Life Sciences Advising Center](https://hls.iupui.edu/)  Health and Life Sciences Advising Center   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster. ## Organizational leadership   ### School of Engineering and Technology  The organizational leadership program prepares students for professional positions in supervisory management and provides a broad-based education for those desiring leadership roles in business, government, or industry. The program grants a Purdue University bachelor of science degree, a certificate in human resource management, a certificate in leadership studies (nonmajors only), and a certificate in international leadership.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Organizational leadership   #### Major information  Organizational leadership  [Organizational leadership](https://et.iupui.edu/departments/tlc/programs/ols/)   #### Get admitted to the School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Admission by certification   ##### Home page  School of Engineering and Technology  [School of Engineering and Technology](http://www.engr.iupui.edu/)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management. ## Mechanical engineering   ### School of Engineering and Technology  One of the fundamental and most diverse engineering disciplines, mechanical engineering equips students to make a difference on the smallest microscale level, as well as in large, complex systems. Each day, mechanical engineering principles are used in the conception, design, development, and manufacture of almost every product or process known to humankind.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. ## About the finance major  Finance majors help corporations sort out the complexities of their investment options and align them with their long-term goals. You'll learn how to create and to maintain wealth, as well as administer and manage money. You'll also study corporate finance, investments, and banking. Every business major will complete a broad base of general business courses. If you're interested in the real estate field, this major provides a track for specialization.  Skills and abilities this major develops : analysis, critical thinking, marketing, and communication.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Connect with other students and future employers,  build leadership and teamwork skills, and have a great time doing it!](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/student-life/student-organizations.html)   #### Student organizations  Connect with other students and future employers,  build leadership and teamwork skills, and have a great time doing it!  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, part-time jobs, or co-op programs. Connect with the Kelley career services team to make an appointment.](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/careers.html)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, part-time jobs, or co-op programs. Connect with the Kelley career services team to make an appointment.  [Study abroad “Business without Borders”—Kelley Indianapolis has programs available in London, Paris, Vienna, Prague, and Italy. Opportunities are also available through Kelley Bloomington’s study abroad program.](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/student-life/study-abroad.html)   #### Study abroad  “Business without Borders”—Kelley Indianapolis has programs available in London, Paris, Vienna, Prague, and Italy. Opportunities are also available through Kelley Bloomington’s study abroad program.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of financial managers is projected to grow 17% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 71,300 openings for financial managers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for finance B.S.B. graduates was $58,211, and the median salary was $56,000.  The national mean starting salary for business graduates who majored in finance was $59,627 for the class of May 2020, according to the National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE, 2022).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Finance majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  I Investigative  E Enterprising  S Social   ### Where to get more information  [Kelley School of Business](https://kelley.iupui.edu/)  Kelley School of Business  [CFA Institute](https://www.cfainstitute.org/)  CFA Institute  [Kelley Indianapolis Career Services](https://kelley.iupui.edu/recruiters-companies/career-services/index.html)  Kelley Indianapolis Career Services   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Informatics   ### Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering  Informatics is smart computing going beyond hardware and software. Informatics thinks big picture, building strong technical skills as well as understanding how we use technology to communicate, work, heal, play, and solve problems that are facing society and industry. It is a way to make a difference in the lives of others, so the focus of the program is on the social impact of computing—how people and technology connect.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Informatics   #### Major information  Informatics  [Informatics](https://luddy.iupui.edu/degrees/undergraduate/informatics/)  Informatics—online  [Informatics—online](https://online.iu.edu/degrees/informatics-bs-undergraduate.html)   #### Get admitted to the Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering   ##### Admission by certification   ##### Home page  [Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering](https://luddy.iupui.edu/)   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## Tourism, conventions, and event management   ### School of Health and Human Sciences (SHHS)  The tourism, conventions, and event management (TCEM) degree allows detail-oriented individuals to call the shots in a fast-paced work environment that changes daily. This is a degree that takes you places, enriches lives, and creates memorable experiences for yourself and others.  You’ll study event management in and out of the classroom, run your own event, and get hands-on experience through extracurricular programs and internships at places like the Indianapolis Children’s Museum, Visit Indy, JW Marriott, Make-A-Wish Foundation, and 500 Festival.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Tourism, conventions, and event management—major-career connections  Tourism, conventions, and event management—career opportunities  [Tourism, conventions, and event management—career opportunities](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ERwiKqFo8dtBnOCCTtcKJX0BQabLVRxgc65l5FiVFStuFQ?e=h8z3nm)   #### Major information  Tourism, conventions, and event management  [Tourism, conventions, and event management](https://shhs.iupui.edu/undergraduate/bachelors-degrees/tcem.html)   #### General information  Course prerequisites  [Course prerequisites](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EXI4D1J5lv9Lq9so4sNKrNwB5ycaBbq_LaOExzFnowy9RA?e=21D27s)   #### Get admitted to the School of Health and Human Sciences   ##### Admission requirements   ##### Home page  [School of Health and Human Sciences](https://shhs.iupui.edu/index.html)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## Art history   ### Herron School of Art and Design  At Herron, you'll learn how to write and to talk about art in the context of history, science, language, culture, and tradition, exploring major movements from Prehistoric to the last two decades. Through visual analysis, historical research, and defined theoretical perspectives, you'll interpret works of art and will make connections between social and cultural contexts across history and throughout the world.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections   #### Major information  [Art history](https://herron.iupui.edu/academics/udegrees/art-history/index.html)   ### Get admitted to the Herron School of Art and Design   ##### Admission by application  [Herron admission application for current IUPUI students](https://herron.iupui.edu/admissions/undergraduate/apply/current-student-application.html)  [Schedule an appointment with a Herron advisor](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/student-services/index.html)   ##### Home page  [Herron School of Art and Design](http://www.herron.iupui.edu/)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.
