# Kristen  Winningham  Student Success Advisor, EPP Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students:  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: Marketing with minors in psychology and neuroscience and a certificate in nutrition. I like to understand the mind/body connection and how nutrition can impact our mental and physical health. Then I'd use my marketing major to educate and share that message to better serve our community.  Quick facts about me: I’m from a small town in Carroll County, Indiana. I currently live in McCordsville with my husband, Craig. I've known for most of my life that I was going to work with students in some sort of capacity. I'm a third-generation educator. As you can see from my alma mater, my retention rate at IUPUI is 100%. I live for basketball season—grew up a Boilermaker fan and continue to bleed black and gold. #Boilerup I really enjoy cooking, fitness, and staying active. My current favorite workout is Reformer Pilates. I also love to travel and consider myself a foodie.

# Maddy Saunders  Student Success Advisor, EXPLR Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students: If you're curious about something, do it! Take a random class you find fascinating, participate in a study abroad program, or join a new organization. You'll learn to step out of your comfort zone, and you might find a new passion. Also, always ask as many questions as you can!  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: Exploratory, because I love the freedom to be unsure about where you're headed, and the opportunity to try new things.  Biography : I grew up in Cincinnati, Ohio, and then hopscotched around the Midwest before settling in Indianapolis. Outside of IUPUI, you can find me exploring Indianapolis, reading a novel from my ridiculously long "to be read" list, or trying to convince myself that I like to cook. I also love to travel, and I'm a (self-proclaimed) expert in finding cheap flights. I've never met a puzzle I didn't like.

## About the ceramics major  Herron’s ceramics curriculum develops your understanding of the medium in the context of contemporary society and historical tradition. You'll gain skills in analysis of specific works of art that are developed through courses in art theory, art history, research methods, and the uses of materials and tools needed to create works of art. You'll also study specific periods, cultures, styles, and themes that exist in the field of art. The ceramics program is supported by lavish space and equipment in the heart of 16 Tech, an innovation community in Indianapolis.  Skills and abilities this major develops: understanding historical contexts, analysis, fine art skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.  [Career services Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Career services  Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.  [Study abroad Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of craft and fine artists is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 5,900 openings for craft and fine artists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for Herron graduates was $34,677, and the median was $35,000.  The national median annual salary for craft and fine artists was $49,960 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Ceramics majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  A Artistic  E Enterprising  R Realistic   ### Where to get more information  [Herron School of Art and Design](https://herron.iupui.edu/)  Herron School of Art and Design  [College Art Association (CAA)](https://www.collegeart.org/)  College Art Association (CAA)  [Herron Career Services](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)  Herron Career Services   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. ## Political science   ### School of Liberal Arts  IUPUI's political science students gain insight into how government works in Indiana, the United States, and countries all over the world. Students are trained to be critical observers and informed, active participants. They are also prepared for a variety of careers—from politics to teaching, law, public administration, and business.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## About the geography major  Geography is the study of spatial patterns and processes associated with phenomena in both the natural world and the world of human affairs. While studying this major, you'll learn about topics such as the spread of disease, the sprawl of cities, the distribution of plants and animals, and the diffusion of culture and ideas based on spatial components.  As a geographer, you'll learn methods of natural sciences, social sciences, and even the arts. You'll also learn about tools to understand the fundamentals of place, including maps, satellite images, interviews, and field work.  Studies and abilities this major develops : analytical skills, communication, critical thinking, writing, and research (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2018).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.  [Career services The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/cdo/)   #### Career services  The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.  [Study abroad Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of cartographers and photogrammetrists is projected to grow 3% from 2021 to 2031, slower than the average for all occupations. Despite limited employment growth, about 1,000 openings for cartographers and photogrammetrists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Liberal Art graduates was $44,206, and the median salary was $38,800 .  The national median annual salary for cartographers and photogrammetrists was $68,900 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Geography majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  I Investigative  R Realistic  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [Department of Geography](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/departments/geography/)  Department of Geography  [American Geographical Society](https://americangeo.org/)  American Geographical Society  [Liberal Arts Office of Career Development](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/centers/cdo/?) # Erica Gleason  Student Success Advisor, HLS Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students: Be open to and hold space for questions: What do you value? What do you enjoy, and what motivates you? How do you learn and work best? Say "yes" to experiences and opportunities that align with those things. Give yourself space to grow, change, and discover.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: Global health. During my undergrad, I took a few courses related to environmental ethics and public health. I loved learning about the ways our relationship to the environment impacts our health and imagining a healthier bigger picture.  Biography : I grew up in Huntington Beach, California, but have lived mostly in Indiana since starting college. I have been a runner since high school and am usually training toward some sort of new goal. I also love all things outdoors—hiking, camping, biking, and looking at trees and birds. I enjoy visiting friends and family, experiencing coffee, and hanging out with my adopted cat, Rocky.

## Majors and careers for social interests   ### For people helpers  Majors and careers can be clustered into six broad interest areas that correspond to six different personality types. Based on the research of Dr. John Holland, this clustering system provides a preliminary way to identify undergraduate majors and careers that might be a satisfying fit for you. Because personality, majors, and careers are too complex to be described by a single interest theme, you will see that the lists below have a three-letter code to more accurately describe majors and careers using a combination of related interests (in order of importance). This “social” page reflects the interest cluster that ranks the “S” theme first, but be sure to review the other five clusters to see if any of those themes (R, I, A, E, C) are more descriptive of your interests.   ### Am I social?  Check off your interests, values, abilities, and qualities to find out.  These are characteristics of the social type. Social people are community-service oriented, interested in educational activities, prefer social interaction, and are concerned with social and religious issues. They like to inform, enlighten, train, develop, and cure others. They may also be skilled with words. If this sounds like you, read on. If not, try one of the other five interest clusters.   ### Social majors  The following is a small sample of majors a social person might find interesting.  [Dental Hygiene](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EaBemNwxGg9ApZ-Gq1MWWTUBHzFn4ZCsg8aML1vWoro1hQ?e=ur4ewu)  [Exercise Science](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EaVicqFgY0pEhdMl2T8GYgwBffs-U1QfcRua93eQd1YQIQ?e=lxBeTy)  [Human Resource Management](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EfEz7zpSgk9Fk8ArNj8RtzkBSM4sY5XiGleYoDQxOzWVgg?e=MnMTN9)  [Nursing](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVG8z1PFkcFMu5ewjx-XtOcBYISznGVMm7b_kSG7JY3-rw?e=cJn1mb)  [Exercise Science](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EaVicqFgY0pEhdMl2T8GYgwBffs-U1QfcRua93eQd1YQIQ?e=lxBeTy)  [Radiation Therapy](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EY75kS0-x0VKlhctAa9SR6ABA25UarvY7l9YnnLE1tMv8w?e=uTXuPY)  [Religious Studies](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ETMmv7kn4sRKgncGbHjRS4AB6ULhJafn5mVLh6If0nfLeQ?e=vuCzuD)  [Respiratory Therapy](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EYNmr-I1A31FoyNTWW8ZQM4B_iTxJD-iQ6yXsxEU2X9FQg?e=NdcObV)  [Social Work](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EdHZmnla28JAtaW2kTq_KOgBbfoJjKg9K-m3sys8DcJmww?e=4QxKob)   ### Social careers  The following is a small sample of careers a social person might choose.  Definitions of the above job titles can be found at ONET Online . For additional social majors or careers, consult your academic advisor or a career counselor.  [ONET Online](https://www.onetonline.org/)   ### Selecting a social major and career  Selecting a major and career is a very involved process, requiring careful evaluation of yourself as well as academic and occupational information. No single questionnaire, assessment, or person can tell you what you should pursue. In order to make the best choices, it is important to consider your unique combination of interests, values, abilities, personality, and experiences.  Keep in mind that majors and careers can accommodate a wide range of interests; an exact fit is not necessary for academic and career satisfaction. The majors and careers above are suggested only as starting points for your exploration. Specific major and career decisions can be discussed in more detail with your academic advisor or career counselor.   ### More information on careers and advising  [Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI](https://www.iupui.edu/academics/degrees-majors/)  Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI  Check sheets for each IUPUI major  [Course descriptions for IUPUI](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/)  Course descriptions for IUPUI  What can I do with a major I choose? ## Africana studies   ### School of Liberal Arts  Africana studies at IUPUI is devoted to the scholarly exploration of African and African American history, life, and culture from an interdisciplinary perspective. The program, as well as various schools and departments within the university, offer a variety of courses, lectures, and other scholarly activities that explore different aspects of the historical and contemporary African as well as the African American experience.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Africana studies—IUPUI   #### Major information  Africana studies  [Africana studies](http://liberalarts.iupui.edu/africana/)   #### Get admitted to the School of Liberal Arts   ##### Admission by certification  Have you met the certification requirements? Let Liberal Arts know.  [Let Liberal Arts know.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/admissions/update-major-form.html)   ##### Home page  School of Liberal Arts  [School of Liberal Arts](http://liberalarts.iupui.edu/)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

# Morris  Jones  Student Success Advisor/Team Coordinator, EPP Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advise to students:  “Hard work works. Working really hard is what successful people do. And in this text, tweet, world that you’ve grown up in, remember just because you’re doing a lot more doesn’t mean you’re getting a lot more done. Don’t confuse movement with progress.”  Denzel Washington: I had a 1.7 GPA. (Retrieved 3/25/19, https://www.goalcast.com/2017/08/15/denzel-washington-2).  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: If I were to choose a major in the EPP cluster to pursue, I would choose philanthropy because it fits best with my worldview of helping others through nonprofit organizations.  Biography: I grew up in central Indiana and have lived most of my life in Indiana. My hobbies include working with wood, building things, and learning something new. To relax, I like science fiction movies (both good and bad) and watching shows like the Walking Dead , the History Channel, and the Discovery Channel. I have coached youth soccer and track. I am married and have two children and five grandchildren. My wife is a bookkeeper and a deputy clerk of the courts. My daughter is an assistant coordinator of the Sport Science Institute at the NCAA, and my son is a captain in the Army.

## Exploratory  The Exploratory cluster is the academic home of University College students who are exploring their options or are unsure of their major/career direction.  We'll help you create a holistic academic and career plan to help you transition into your major and degree-granting school through structured guidance and strategic planning. We work with you to learn and apply your values, interests, personality, and skills (VIPS) in discovering your individualized academic and career pathways.  We encourage exploratory students to engage in purposeful and productive co-curricular activities, such as research, study abroad, service learning, and internships, to prepare for the transition into the world of work.   ### Resources to explore majors and careers   #### Academic resources  [Exploratory degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/maps/view?mapId=333683ca-a318-400a-bcbb-8e7a701902f4)   #### Career resources  [Interest booklet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ET0ZMGp8A3FPiGeG3i004iQBBUn1gMvOLGf6EJttVrmBug?e=zHGMPL)  [interest code sheet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EY_9MIr7qHFFt-8fTYehBEoBMjKGjyK-cqP8lvIjG7VMvg?e=6jhBQ9)  [What can I do with this major?](https://whatcanidowiththismajor.com/)  [O*Net](https://www.onetonline.org/)  [O*Net interest profiler](https://www.mynextmove.org/explore/ip)  [Occupational Outlook Handbook](https://www.bls.gov/ooh/)   ### Our Exploratory team   #### Student success advisors  Suzanne Guinn  Maddy Saunders   #### Director  Mike Slocum   ### Connect with our cluster  Follow us on Instagram to get important updates and information! ## About the music therapy major  The Bachelor of Science in Music Therapy is an approved program of the American Music Therapy Association that provides the musical, technical, and therapeutic skills to practice as entry-level music therapists in a variety of clinical fields. You'll engage in traditional academic music studies (e.g., music theory, aural skills, music history), piano, voice, guitar, percussion, improvisation, music technology, psychology, and specific music therapy courses.  Graduates of the program take the national certification examination administered by the Certification Board for Music Therapists (CBMT). After passing this exam, you'll be a board-certified music therapist (Purdue School of Engineering and Technology, 2019).  Skills and abilities this major develops: musical knowledge and ability, problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, active listening, and social perceptiveness skills.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of recreational therapists is projected to grow 4% from 2021 to 2031, as fast as the average for all occupations. About 1,500 openings for recreational therapists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for the School of Engineering and Technology graduates with a bachelor's degree was $58,879, and the median salary was $60,000.  The national median annual salary for recreational therapists was $47,940 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Some music therapy majors pursue graduate or professional school to work in areas such as clinical or counseling psychology, research, or medicine. Many others obtain graduate degrees in music therapy, school counseling, music theory, and music composition.   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  A Artistic  I Investigative  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [Purdue School of Engineering and Technology](https://et.iupui.edu/)  Purdue School of Engineering and Technology  [American Music Therapy Association](https://www.musictherapy.org/)  American Music Therapy Association  [National Association of Schools of Music (NASM)](https://nasm.arts-accredit.org/)  National Association of Schools of Music (NASM)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

# Ryan Cook  Career Consultant, HLS Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students: Always strive to reach your goals and dreams—nothing is out of reach. Use this time in college to set yourself up for success and for a career you will love! We are here to help, listen, and provide the resources you need to find success!  Biography : I grew up in Bargersville, but now reside on the west side of Indy with my family. I really enjoy running in local races, traveling, photography, and supporting my kids in their activities at school.

## About the electrical engineering technology major  An electrical engineering technology major will prepare you to solve problems related to generating, distributing, transmitting, and using electrical energy. You'll apply your knowledge to help design and develop computers, communications equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and other electrical and electronic equipment.  An engineering technology degree is different than engineering because the class and laboratory work is focused on applications. As you learn theories of how things work, you'll apply them in immediate, relevant ways.  Skills and abilities this major develops : logical thinking skills, mechanical skills, math skills (for analysis, design and troubleshooting), observational skills, and teamwork.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of electrical and electronic engineering technologists and technicians is projected to show little or no change from 2021 to 2031. Despite limited employment growth, about 11,000 openings for electrical and electronic engineering technologists and technicians are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Most of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for e lectrical engineering technology B.S. graduates was $55,000, and the median was $51,500.  The national median annual salary for electrical and electronic engineering technologists and technicians was $63,640 in 2021 (O ccupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Engineering technology graduates often pursue advanced degrees in areas such as:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  R Realistic  I Investigative  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [School of Engineering and Technology](https://et.iupui.edu/)  School of Engineering and Technology  [Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers](https://ieeeusa.org/)  Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers  [Engineering Technology Accreditation](https://www.nicet.org/become-certified/)  Engineering Technology Accreditation   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## About the biology major  Biology is a natural science concerned with the study of life through the observation of structure, function, reproduction, growth, origin, evolution, and behavior of living organisms as they relate to their natural environment.  Through coursework and research, you'll gain an understanding of foundational events in biology, as well as current developments and discoveries. Studying biology prepares you to use scientific knowledge to make informed decisions benefiting all living things.  Skills and abilities this major develops: application of the scientific process to address biological problems using hypothesis-driven inquiry; experiment design, data collection, and quantitative reasoning; research and documentation; and written comprehension and expression.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Undergraduate research Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.](https://science.iupui.edu/research/student-opportunities/index.html)   #### Undergraduate research  Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources.](https://iu.instructure.com/enroll/6E3KLT)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources.  [Center for Service and Learning The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways.](https://csl.iupui.edu/)   #### Center for Service and Learning  The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of biological technicians is projected to grow 9% from 2021 to 2031, faster than the average for all occupations. About 12,200 openings for biological technicians are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for graduates with a Bachelor of Science in Biology was $40,333, and the median salary was $40,000.  The national median annual salary for biological technicians was $48,140 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Between 25% and 50% of biology students proceed directly to graduate school in biology or biology-related fields or to schools of medicine, veterinary medicine, or dentistry.  In addition, biology majors often pursue advanced degrees in areas such as:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  I Investigative  R Realistic  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [Department of Biology](https://science.iupui.edu/biology/)  Department of Biology  [IUPUI Biology Club](https://thespot.iupui.edu/organization/biologyclub)  IUPUI Biology Club  [American Institute of Biological Sciences](https://www.aibs.org/)  American Institute of Biological Sciences   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools. ## Marketing   ### Kelley School of Business  Simply put, marketing is all about making exchanges. In the world of business, it’s about offering something—a product or service, a cause, packaging, reputation, an image or a brand—in exchange for financial compensation. But for that to work, companies have to know what customers want, what they are willing to exchange, and how to move consumers to buy or bestow, volunteer or vote, make a trade, or make a difference. And that’s where marketing professionals come in.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## About the organizational leadership major  The organizational leadership major equips you with leadership knowledge and skills needed to work in a wide spectrum of careers, including frontline supervision, human resources, project management, training and development, manufacturing and production, and human service organizations. The blended, hands-on curriculum provides the flexibility to prepare you for leadership roles no matter where you are in your career. The program incorporates group dynamics, global leadership perspectives, theory, and practice. Many organizational leadership courses are offered in a variety of formats to accommodate busy students and professionals.  Skills and abilities the major develops: communication, leadership, human resource management, project management, analytical, and decision-making.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of human resources managers is projected to grow 7% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 16,300 openings for human resources managers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for graduates with a B.S. in Organizational Leadership was $46,149, and the median salary was $47,000 .  The national median annual salary for human resources managers was $126,230 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Organizational leadership graduates often pursue advanced degrees in areas such as:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  E Enterprising  R Realistic  S Social   ### Where to get more information  [Purdue School of Engineering and Technology (ET 331 or 317-278-1313)](https://et.iupui.edu/)   #### Purdue School of Engineering and Technology  (ET 331 or 317-278-1313)  [American Management Association](https://www.amanet.org)  American Management Association  [Society for Human Resource Management](https://www.shrm.org)  Society for Human Resource Management   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. ## About the drawing and illustration major  Studying fine arts at IUPUI in the Herron School of Art and Design is your first step in building a meaningful and influential career in art and design. You'll study the historical development of art as a social and intellectual phenomenon. You'll also learn about art firsthand with Indianapolis community partners and will find opportunities and resources to bring your artistic concepts to fruition. All majors spend the first year building foundational skills. Fine arts majors include: ceramics, drawing and illustration, furniture design, painting, photography, printmaking, and sculpture.  Skills and abilities the major develops: understanding historical contexts, analysis, fine arts skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## Photography   ### Herron School of Art and Design  You'll receive a thorough education in the history of this art form as well as instruction in all of the relevant technology and techniques. Traditional wet printing techniques in black-and-white and color photography form a foundation for the department’s introduction to photographic imaging. Time-based and digital media are incorporated in the intermediate and advanced classes, encouraging an interdisciplinary approach to the photographic medium. This methodology is integral to the department’s approach to visual literacy in contemporary photography, placing emphasis on your personal growth and your conceptual and aesthetic development.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Preparing for registration  Priority registration is a two-week window for current students to register for the upcoming semester. Each student is assigned an enrollment date and time. You can register for classes any time after your enrollment date.   ### How to view your enrollment date  From your Student Center:  [One.IU.edu](https://one.iu.edu)  From SOAR (Student Online Advising Record):  [One.IU.edu](https://one.iu.edu)   ### Connect with your advisor  Remember that your registration appointment in One.IU is not an appointment with an advisor. It’s the time when you may register for classes. Plan ahead and set up an appointment with your advisor as soon as possible. Since priority registration is a busy time of year, waiting until the last minute may delay when you can register for your classes. You can make an appointment using our online reservation system below or by calling (317) 274-4856.  Remember that your registration appointment in One.IU is not an appointment with an advisor. # Jessa Trimble  Director of Professional Development and HLSAC  [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessa-trimble-72416813/ )  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advice to students: Really think about why you are here. Why is a college education important to you? Why is IUPUI important to you? When you identify those values, then set goals, seek experiences, and seize opportunities that will continue to drive that motivation.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: I would love to be an epidemiology major! I am a problem solver, so the idea of investigating the spread of disease and creating strategies to keep the public safe and healthy is fascinating to me.  Biography : I am originally from the Indianapolis area and have spent my entire life in Indiana. And while I love home, I also love to travel. Some of the more exciting places I have visited include Iceland; Banff National Park in Canada; and San Juan, Puerto Rico. I also love to hike and spend time outdoors when the weather is nice! When the weather isn’t nice, I read, work on puzzles, and watch lots of TV and movies. I now live in Fishers with my husband. Some of my favorite things include coffee, chocolate, the color blue, to-do lists, bonfires, friends, and family.

## About the global health protection major  Global health protectors work to improve public health by identifying, tracking, and addressing environmental risk factors. They perform research, educate the public, help develop and implement public policy, improve the practices of businesses and the government, and create new technologies to help make our world cleaner and safer. Topics of interest in this field include energy use and climate change, electronic waste, managing the safety and scarcity of food and water, and dealing with migrant health on a global scale.  Skills and abilities this major develops : ability to analyze data and policy, critical thinking and problem solving, scientific inquiry, and ability to communicate information.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website. ## About the computer science major  Computer and information science emphasizes a fundamental understanding of computing, information processing, and information communication. You'll learn basic principles of computing and data processing, including the creation, representation, storage, transformation, and transmission of information.  The computer science major exposes you to language processing, end-use applications, principles of computer hardware and software components, databases, application testing, and more. Programming and math courses are essential to the Bachelor of Science degree.  As the field of computing is constantly changing, career options will continue to emerge. Graduates work in roles such as programming, software development, database administration, research, systems analysis, management, and many others.  Skills and abilities this major develops: analytical and problem solving, project management, attention to detail, and expertise in teamwork and communication.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Undergraduate research Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.](https://science.iupui.edu/research/student-opportunities/index.html)   #### Undergraduate research  Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources.](https://iu.instructure.com/enroll/6E3KLT)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources. Despite limited employment growth, about 11,000 openings for computer network architects are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Most of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Science graduates was $45,303, and the median was $40,000.  The national mean starting salary for computer science graduates was $85,766 for the class of May 2020, according to the National Association of Colleges and Employers (2022). ## About the healthcare engineering technology management major  Professionals in the field of healthcare engineering technology manage and support the manufacturing and use of existing medical devices and technology in patient care. They also work on project management, helping hospitals and other facilities plan their technology needs and train practitioners. You can pursue either an associate or bachelor’s degree in this field. IUPUI’s campus is connected to four hospitals, and most students complete an internship as part of their degree program.  Studies and abilities this major develops : critical thinking and problem solving, communication skills, teamwork, use of technology, attention to detail, and knowledge of healthcare systems.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of medical equipment repairers is projected to grow 17% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 7,700 openings for medical equipment repairers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for engineering and technology graduates was $58,879, and the median salary was $60,000.  The national median annual salary for medical equipment repairers was $49,910 in May 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). ## About the fine arts major  Studying fine arts at IUPUI in the Herron School of Art and Design is your first step in building a meaningful and influential career in art and design. You'll study the historical development of art as a social and intellectual phenomenon. You'll also learn about art firsthand with Indianapolis community partners and will find opportunities and resources to bring your artistic concepts to fruition. All majors spend the first year building foundational skills. Fine arts majors include ceramics, drawing and illustration, furniture design, painting, photography, printmaking, and sculpture.  Skills and abilities the major develops: understanding historical contexts, analysis, fine arts skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2019).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.  [Career services Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Career services  Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.  [Study abroad Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of craft and fine artists is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, as fast as average for all occupations. About 5,900 openings for craft and fine artists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for the art and design graduates was $34,677, and the median salary was $35,000  The national median annual salary for craft and fine artists $49,960 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). ## Discover yourself  Additional assessments are available to IUPUI students for a small fee. Learn about the benefits of the Strong Interest Inventory or the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) by talking with your career consultant. Just call (317) 274-4856, and we'll direct you through the process and help you interpret the results.  The Strong Interest Inventory is a self-assessment instrument that can be used to help you discover your interests. This information can be used to assist with educational and career decisions. The questionnaire asks about your preferences in regard to hobbies, occupations, personal characteristics, leisure activities, occupational activities, school subjects, and types of people. It takes 35–40 minutes to complete. A fee of $21 must be paid prior to taking the inventory.  Your results come in the form of a report, which you will discuss with a career consultant. Even though the report includes a list of occupations that might be suitable for you based on your answers, they may or may not be the best fit. You should always thoroughly explore any occupation you are considering.  The Myers-Briggs Type Indicator is a self-inventory designed to identify a person's personality type, strengths, and preferences. Developed by Isabel Myers and her mother Katherine Briggs, the MBTI is based on their work with Carl Jung's theory of personality types. By developing an indicator that could be used to help people understand individual differences, Myers and Briggs believed that they could help people select occupations that were best suited to their personality types.  [Carl Jung's](http://psychology.about.com/od/profilesofmajorthinkers/p/jungprofile.htm)  The goal of the MBTI is to help you further explore and understand your own personality, including likes, dislikes, strengths, weaknesses, possible career preferences, and compatibility with others. No one personality type is best or better than any other one. The goal is simply to help you learn more about yourself. Once you pay the $17 fee, you can complete the MBTI online. In a follow-up appointment, you will discuss the results with a career consultant.

## Discover your path  The process of choosing a major or deciding whether or not you should change your major can be overwhelming. The steps below will help you get started in deciding what to do. Contact your Academic and Career Development team if you would like help.  Step #1: Learn about yourself  If you want to be confident about your major and career decisions, start by looking at yourself. Determine what drives you, your interests, your strengths, and what you want out of life. You can know all about possible majors and explore lots of careers, but your research will be much more productive if you can identify what you need and want in a career first . Learning about yourself and what makes you tick makes the next steps much easier.  There are four dimensions of self that should guide your decisions: values, interests, personality, and skills (VIPS). Let's look more closely at your VIPS and how they impact your work and personal life.   #### VIPS  To make good, informed decisions about majors and careers, first look at your values, interests, personality, and skills.   #### Self-assessment  Your answers to the questions asked in each assessment below will help you identify your values, interests, personality traits, and skills.  Step #2: Create a targeted list of options  What are your interests? Consider the coursework you will be taking as part of the major. Will you enjoy the majority of the classes?  Some occupations prefer certain majors, coursework, or preparation. What major(s) will help you reach your professional goals? How can you develop the skills and qualities employers seek?  Use your answers to these questions to create a list of majors and careers to explore.  While some majors tend to connect to certain occupations, most majors lead to a variety of careers. Many major paths can lead to the same career destination.   #### Majors  Review a list of majors that IUPUI offers.  Step #3: Collect information  Major exploration is a critical step in your decision making. Unfortunately, many people make decisions about a major based on inadequate or inaccurate information. IUPUI has over 200 programs, so your strongest, most informed choices require current, realistic, and accurate information. What are the degree and admissions requirements? Resources on this site will answer many of your questions.  Standards and admission requirements vary widely by major. Review required courses and determine what’s necessary to be admitted to the specific program you're interested in. Once you have gathered this information, talk with people. Visit advisors in the schools, as well as faculty, upperclassmen, or even alumni with degrees from these programs. As you review information, if you have questions about choosing or changing a major, program requirements, or academic planning, just contact us. We want to help you succeed.   #### Degree requirements  Consider degree requirements when choosing your major.  Step #4: Connect majors to careers  Maybe you have majors in mind, but aren't sure how they connect to careers. With our major-career connections sheets, you will get an overview of each major along with career opportunities, employment options, and links to additional information.  [Interest code booklet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ET0ZMGp8A3FPiGeG3i004iQBBUn1gMvOLGf6EJttVrmBug?e=SmCtX1)  Interest code booklet  Match your interests  Major-career connections sheets  More on majors and careers  If you have questions or need a resource above in an accessible format, please email Mike Slocum.  Step #5: Evaluate your options and create a plan  Now you’ve researched majors and identified which could best fit your unique situation. What’s next? Confirm your decisions with information from professionals and related experiences. When you’re ready, be sure to update your major. Make a plan to get hands-on knowledge and to gain skills.   #### Update your major  When you're ready, fill out this form to update your major.   #### Explore careers  Begin gaining experience and creating professional contacts.

## Steps to update your major   ### Exploring majors and careers  Exploration of your major and career interests is important. You should feel confident about the major you choose to ensure your time and money are being well spent and that your courses will allow you to progress toward your degree.  Check out exploration resources   ### Complete the form to update your major  Once you are confident in your selection, use the form below to request an update to your major, minor, certificate, and/or pre-professional interest. This form can only be used once per semester to update your major. If you have already updated your major once before in this semester, please meet with your student success advisor to discuss your desire for an additional update. This process is only for enrolled University College students at IUPUI.  Major/minor update request  [Major/minor update request](https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_cwnkn2LxjaeKYXr)

## About the civic leadership major  Civic leadership is one of IUPUI’s designated pre-law majors. Your coursework will include political science, law, public policy, leadership, ethics, and nonprofit organization. You can help run a city or state, turn community or political activism into a career, and make a difference in the place where you live. This major gives you the option to tailor electives to your specific interests, including politics, international affairs, or nonprofit management.  Skills and abilities this major develops : management, negotiation, strategic planning, and team building.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations O’Neill’s student organizations engage the community at all levels and give students the resources and tools they need to succeed during and after college.](https://oneill.iupui.edu/student-life/student-orgs.html)   #### Student organizations  O’Neill’s student organizations engage the community at all levels and give students the resources and tools they need to succeed during and after college.  [Career services O’Neill’s career services office is designed to help you build your job-search skills and find full-time employment or an internship. They can also help you connect with alumni!](https://oneill.iupui.edu/student-life/career-development/index.html)   #### Career services  O’Neill’s career services office is designed to help you build your job-search skills and find full-time employment or an internship. They can also help you connect with alumni!  [Study abroad Enrich your academic experience by studying important public policy and criminal justice issues at a global level.](https://oneill.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Enrich your academic experience by studying important public policy and criminal justice issues at a global level.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of urban and regional planners is projected to grow 4% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 3,800 openings for urban and regional planners are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook, 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for the O'Neill School of Public and Environment Affairs graduates with a bachelor's degree was $45,726, and the median was $45,500.  The national median annual salary for urban and regional planners was $78,500 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Civic leadership majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  E Enterprising  S Social  I Investigative   ### Where to get more information  [O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs](https://oneill.iupui.edu/)  O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs  [American Planning Association](https://www.planning.org/)  American Planning Association  [O'Neill Career Services](https://oneill.iupui.edu/student-life/career-development/index.html)  O'Neill Career Services   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management. ## Human resource management   ### Kelley School of Business  Human resource (HR) managers are the epitome of “people” people. Think of them as casting directors who help put the right people in the right job—and then develop the culture and compensation packages to keep them motivated. But the focus of HR is bigger than acquiring and managing talent.  While human resource managers do recruit, hire, train, and assess a company's talent—what many would call an organization’s true assets—their core role is to understand how to get people to be the best they can be and turn their performance into success for the organization. To that end, human resource managers play a strategic role, impacting decisions about organizational structure, change management, work design, and more.  When you enter the human resource management field, you may travel the traditional route of human resources and labor relations—such as compliance with employment and labor laws, management development, wage and salary administration, organizational planning, and contract negotiation—or you may choose to jump into the newer areas in the behavioral sciences, tracking their implications for human resource management programs.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Degree planning information  Current program offerings may be found in your pre-business student Canvas site.   #### Major-career connections  Human resource management   #### Get admitted to the Kelley School of Business   ##### Admission by certification  Current IUPUI students no longer have to submit an application to be admitted from University College to the Kelley School of Business Undergraduate Program. You'll be notified when the admission requirements are met. To certify into the Kelley School of Business from University College, you'll need to meet one of the sets of admission criteria . You'll be certified as soon as you meet either set of criteria.  [admission criteria](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EcwEAw_wtUVLuODPWHp7WM4Bojo7dz43egO1kg2giCZk9A?e=TmKTI6)   ##### Certification process   ##### Home pages  [Kelley School of Business](https://kelley.iupui.edu/)  [Kelley—majors information](http://kelley.iupui.edu/undergrad/academics/majors/)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management. ## Exploratory  The Exploratory cluster is the academic home of University College students who are exploring their options or are unsure of their major/career direction.  We'll help you create a holistic academic and career plan to help you transition into your major and degree-granting school through structured guidance and strategic planning. We work with you to learn and apply your values, interests, personality, and skills (VIPS) in discovering your individualized academic and career pathways.  We encourage exploratory students to engage in purposeful and productive co-curricular activities, such as research, study abroad, service learning, and internships, to prepare for the transition into the world of work.   ### Resources to explore majors and careers   #### Academic resources  [Exploratory degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/maps/view?mapId=333683ca-a318-400a-bcbb-8e7a701902f4)   #### Career resources  [Interest booklet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ET0ZMGp8A3FPiGeG3i004iQBBUn1gMvOLGf6EJttVrmBug?e=zHGMPL)  [interest code sheet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EY_9MIr7qHFFt-8fTYehBEoBMjKGjyK-cqP8lvIjG7VMvg?e=6jhBQ9)  [What can I do with this major?](https://whatcanidowiththismajor.com/)  [O*Net](https://www.onetonline.org/)  [O*Net interest profiler](https://www.mynextmove.org/explore/ip)  [Occupational Outlook Handbook](https://www.bls.gov/ooh/)   ### Our Exploratory team   #### Student success advisors  Suzanne Guinn  Maddy Saunders   #### Director  Mike Slocum   ### Connect with our cluster  Follow us on Instagram to get important updates and information! ## About the anthropology major  Anthropology is the study of human behavior. This major encourages you to explore the origin and behavior of humans and their physical, social, and cultural development. Anthropologists study the way of life, remains, language, and physical characteristics of people around the world. They compare customs, values, and social patterns of different cultures, past and present. Archaeologists reconstruct a record of extinct cultures, especially preliterate ones, to determine age and cultural identity by classifying and interpreting artifacts, architectural features, and types of structures recovered by excavation (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.  [Career services The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/cdo/)   #### Career services  The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.  [Study abroad Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of anthropologists and archeologists is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 800 openings for anthropologists and archeologists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Liberal Arts graduates was $44,206, and the median salary was $38,800 .  The national median annual salary for anthropologists and archeologists was $61,910 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Anthropology majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  I Investigative  R Realistic  S Social   ### Where to get more information  [Department of Anthropology (CA 143)](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/departments/anthropology/)   #### Department of Anthropology  (CA 143)  [Society for Applied Anthropology](https://www.appliedanthro.org/)  Society for Applied Anthropology  [Archaeological Institute of America](https://www.archaeological.org/)  Archaeological Institute of America   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)
