## YouTube, TED Talks, ACD videos, and articles  Need a video to help explain a concept in your first-year seminar? These TED Talks, YouTubes, and other clips were collected just for you. Use the short descriptions below to find videos that fit your curriculum. The form is a guide to help you easily decipher the video’s length, main purpose, and discussion points for class and possible reflection questions for a student assignment.  If you need a resource in an accessible format, please contact Mike Slocum .   ### Time management and good habits  *Matt Cutts: Try something new for 30 days  [*Matt Cutts: Try something new for 30 days](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EbudKF9yB0ZMowKyXJYwmhcBWVuRuTH4gYLXkxZ6KxCamg?e=gsfJrT)  This video introduces the concept of study habits and time management and gives one way to try to change the ones a student comes into college with.  Which student are you?  [Which student are you?](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EX6xI_NMjB1JkyWQG9hKmZQBpZhMJHaDa20v7HlUMrpIVg?e=vX5p0d)  This video emphasizes education as a means for self-improvement and the opportunity to make college a fresh start.  The time you have  [The time you have](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ETLfL78dRVhDqkDAOAc1cjMBvKnzj16NAODkMq65XzyAFg?e=0HsctZ)  This video is good as a motivational piece and could pair well with a time management lecture.   ### Making decisions  *Ruth Chang: How to make hard choices  [*Ruth Chang: How to make hard choices](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EflVAE82MLFGuXIzQKT4XyQBijCeOVV_xPSlI_r1sZH3Pw?e=qmRJfK)  This is a good video for students because it emphasizes the importance of personal values against outside pressure. It’s good for them to know that they have options and don’t have to drift.  *Chimamanda Adichie: The danger of a single story  [*Chimamanda Adichie: The danger of a single story](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ETpziVMODZZLnxs5Gf7Xw3gBkHklc-zoiPgE3V4zPyK5MQ?e=Eue3JH)  This video focuses on the necessity of having multiple points of view and not accepting one story as the definitive idea of anything. This is a great way to discuss choosing majors and not choosing based on one piece of information.   ### Leadership  *Derek Sivers: How to start a movement  [*Derek Sivers: How to start a movement](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EUxZwF5-YbhPrd7MemfAP8YBGYJ8REzgcp5eE_AOVQKN4A?e=cRHfXX)  This video emphasizes the fact that there isn’t just one leader in any situation and that it takes multiple people to get things going. *Simon Sinek: How great leaders inspire action  [*Simon Sinek: How great leaders inspire action](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EakSKLifPA5EurFBCQMAs5EB-IMSeebTL8PxXNFIZ32u5w?e=eK0s63)  This video reminds students that they need to be driven by a purpose.   ### Motivation  *Angela Lee Duckworth: Grit  [*Angela Lee Duckworth: Grit](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ERx-l62IwcNAu55v4USmQcgBYx5smy2yCjqGrUEIKzNCuA?e=bpK1ef)  This is good for students because it advocates for a new perspective on failure. This is especially good for first-year students, especially those who did well in high school because they tend to shut down when the first thing goes wrong in a semester. *Margaret Heffernan: Dare to disagree  [*Margaret Heffernan: Dare to disagree](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EYzSG0tJFj1LkJInLc8KuxQB2w6RX3AfACBd-XkqL51CyA?e=8ssb7F)  This video speaks about critical thinking and questioning what we think we know. It helps students to understand how to think critically and how to describe what it means to think critically.   ### Academic and Career Development videos   #### Get to know us  * Meet the ACD staff  [Meet the ACD staff](https://vimeo.com/106387940)  This video allows your students to meet the student success advisors and career consultants in University College Academic and Career Development (ACD). Our team is here to serve students and to help them plan for success—both during college and after. Watch this video with your students to introduce them to the staff in the office.   #### Explore your options  * Never stop exploring  [Never stop exploring](https://vimeo.com/129795047)  College is the time for students to learn more about themselves, discover new interests, and take initiative to shape their future. This video provides an overview of the possibilities and how ACD can assist students in the process of self-discovery. The intent of this video is to get students excited about the career development process and the possibilities of experiential learning.   #### Student exploration stories  *Student interviews on major exploration  [*Student interviews on major exploration](https://vimeo.com/129795044)  This video introduces IUPUI students who went through the process of exploring majors. Students will be able to learn about the stories and the advice their peers have to offer regarding career exploration. Through this video, the process of major exploration is normalized.

## Your support team  You have lots of support at IUPUI. University College is the academic home and advising resource for most first-year students at IUPUI. We also work with students beyond the first year as they prepare for admission to a degree-granting program.  Academic and Career Development offers you a team of student success advisors and career consultants to help you explore your interests, choose a major, and create a plan to achieve your academic and personal goals. Once you transition to your degree-granting school, you can work with your school's advisors, career professionals, and even faculty to prepare for a successful career.  As a University College student, you'll be advised through Academic and Career Development and the Health and Life Sciences Advising Center. Student success advisors and career consultants work in clusters of majors with similar themes and interests to help you transition in and beyond University College to your degree-granting school.   ### Clusters   #### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services  For University College students pursuing majors in education, music, art and design, liberal arts, social work, philanthropy, public service, and general studies.   #### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning  For University College students pursuing majors in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.   #### Health and Life Sciences  For University College students pursuing majors in health and life sciences.   #### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics  For University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing.   #### Exploratory  For University College students who are exploratory or undecided about their majors.

## Majors and careers for realistic interests   ### For the technically and athletically inclined  Majors and careers can be organized into six broad interest areas that correspond to six different interest types. Based on the research of Dr. John Holland, the system provides a preliminary way to identify undergraduate majors and careers that might be a satisfying fit for you. Because personality, majors, and careers are too complex to be described by a single interest theme, you will see that the lists below have a three-letter code to more accurately describe majors and careers using a combination of related interests (in order of importance). This “realistic” page reflects the interest cluster that ranks the “R” theme first, but be sure to review the other five clusters to see if any of those themes (I, A, S, E, C) are more descriptive of your interests.   ### Am I realistic?  Check off your interests, values, abilities, and qualities to find out.  These are characteristics of the realistic type. Realistic people are aggressive, prefer concrete versus abstract tasks, and are less sociable and less skilled at interpersonal interactions. They have athletic or mechanical ability and often prefer to work outdoors with objects, machines, tools, plants, or animals. If this sounds like you, read on. If not, try one of the other five interest clusters.   ### Realistic majors  The following is a small sample of majors a realistic person might find interesting.  [Anthropology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVu2KpCA-aFMq5hEiP80WfABXcc44RSYoQpiXrIINCadxQ?e=7dRBb7)  [Biomedical Engineering](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EdiyyLO9vytGnY9CoeoFUrMBeKb3j9uHwFoqOEJOIKct5w?e=idr135)  [Biotechnology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EZdvOuZPmW1NgMJnJUH9N0YBLXI7dMzPusT9m-WeYUyJ4A?e=PuS6NI)  [Chemistry](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EXIHVhS20D9GsTYzB0hYb6ABrPjbZMIuUQa9egapM_Vrxg?e=aKDNHY)  [Computer Engineering](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EQgdoLtW4upOpY5LlV_t0iIBdftbSgJ4RUBcQvCJu73-Iw?e=rqKWkl)  [Computer and Information Technology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EdHa8OGBE25Cl5lOr_2an0wBMRK2nfHgkTE58kZY2z-0BA?e=3zWysK)  [Construction Engineering Management Technology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EYzNAgnkXHRGlj5-myHt-ucBmnmL0c0jPiXuCHNtt5rczQ?e=x1POy6)  [Electrical Engineering](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ee3T8RjYxM9Hiy6vmcU009gBQbestUxvWiLibz92lTgY8g?e=lBGJed)  [Environmental Health Science](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EexgermhKV1Ag7VJi4HPPDoBgPHQkhmC_c6L0xaxnxI2rg?e=imX2Y2)  [Geography](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ef9RUeJPok5JgRE0WIutdf0BQEGqNdEzK-zdFb1Ei_wRMQ?e=svs6TK)  [Mathematics](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EXQwNYT1fG5HgVOuKx7abvsBNsdIdwwbQ-vF2Af4fMFo2g?e=9HgBxk)  [Mechanical Engineering](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EYYbRnn0nGJOtmcDhRUP_38Bi3Vfirun7UnpOX6fuezp3A?e=9d7EIL)  [Paramedic Science](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ES1GC1selTZIrrqb77HUcvsB1OR8Gzssa70SR6BeCNoa0g?e=PGaxvR)  [Physics](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EZSjEbuLBZ9MoUJvc6pH62gBekIvlxRf4LIVu_f7tf4oWg?e=uZ65rX)   ### Realistic careers  The following is a small sample of careers a realistic person might choose.  Definitions of the above job titles can be found at O-NET Online . For additional realistic majors or careers, consult your academic advisor or a career counselor.  [O-NET Online](http://www.onetonline.org/)   ### Selecting a realistic major and career  Selecting a major and career is a very involved process, requiring careful evaluation of yourself as well as academic and occupational information. No single questionnaire, assessment, or person can tell you what you should pursue. In order to make the best choices, it is important to consider your unique combination of interests, values, abilities, personality, and experiences.  Keep in mind that majors and careers can accommodate a wide range of interests; an exact fit is not necessary for academic and career satisfaction. The majors and careers above are suggested only as starting points for your exploration. Specific major and career decisions can be discussed in more detail with your academic advisor or career counselor.   ### More information on careers and advising  [Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI](http://www.iupui.edu/academic/schoolsdepts.htm)  Schools, majors, and degrees offered at IUPUI  Check sheets for each IUPUI major  [Course descriptions for IUPUI](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/)  Course descriptions for IUPUI  What can I do with a major I choose? ## Computer science   ### School of Science  The use of computer systems is pervasive in society, creating an ongoing demand for people who can provide the technical knowledge to support an array of systems and applications. Sophisticated and complex technology is being implemented across all organizations, and maintaining the computer network is essential to almost every organization. Our graduates enter the workplace armed with the technical proficiency, project management skills, communication expertise, and high-level skills needed to develop working solutions for computing challenges into the future.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. ## About the nursing major  Nursing majors study current trends in health care and focus on wellness/illness concepts and delivery of care in hospital and community-based settings. While nursing relies heavily on the social abilities of the person giving care, it also requires a large base of scientific knowledge. Nursing is a large occupational arena involving diverse and changing roles and includes areas of specialty in surgery, maternity, pediatrics, emergency room, intensive care, and more.  Skills and abilities that this major develops: critical thinking and problem solving, communication skills, teamwork, cultural competency, knowledge of human anatomy, and physiology.   #### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Center for Service and Learning The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways. Find a health-related experience to build your resume while giving back to others!](https://csl.iupui.edu/)   #### Center for Service and Learning  The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways. Find a health-related experience to build your resume while giving back to others!  [Student organizations Join the Student Nurses Association or the student chapter of the American Association for Men in Nursing to meet fellow pre-nursing or current nursing students and learn more about careers.](https://thespot.iupui.edu)   #### Student organizations  Join the Student Nurses Association or the student chapter of the American Association for Men in Nursing to meet fellow pre-nursing or current nursing students and learn more about careers.  [Professional work experience A job in a hospital or working as a CNA can provide you with valuable insight into the nursing profession.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  A job in a hospital or working as a CNA can provide you with valuable insight into the nursing profession.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of registered nurses is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 203,200 openings for registered nurses are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for graduates with a B.S. in Nursing was $54,652, and the median salary was $51,000.  The national median annual salary for registered nurses was $77,600 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Nursing students often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional education or training.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  I Investigative  R Realistic  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [IU School of Nursing](https://nursing.iupui.edu/)  IU School of Nursing  [Nurses for a Healthier Tomorrow](https://www.nursesource.org)  Nurses for a Healthier Tomorrow  [American Nurses Association](https://www.nursingworld.org/)  American Nurses Association   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster. ## About the health services management major  The health services management major gives you a foundation in business while sharpening your expertise in the growing health care industry. You'll be trained to balance priorities and budgets, to solve fiscal and managerial problems, and to meet legal mandates, all while upholding the highest standards of public health and health care. You'll also be immersed and challenged in courses in health care finance and budgeting, management, managed care, health care law, marketing and communications, human resources, organizational leadership, strategic planning, and U.S. health policy.  Studies and abilities this major develops: prioritizing, leadership and management, health care law and policy, communication skills, knowledge of health care systems, and principles of business.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Undergraduate research Much of public health work relies on solid data. Hone your research skills through an on-campus experience!](https://crl.iupui.edu)   #### Undergraduate research  Much of public health work relies on solid data. Hone your research skills through an on-campus experience!  [Study abroad Ever wanted to travel to Sweden? China? Colombia? There are many opportunities available through IU to study abroad and to gain insight into global health systems.](https://fsph.iupui.edu/academics/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Ever wanted to travel to Sweden? China? Colombia? There are many opportunities available through IU to study abroad and to gain insight into global health systems.  [Student organizations Whether it’s Fairbanks’ very own Undergraduate Student Association or the Public Health Corps, there are several ways to get involved with student groups that are focused on public health!](https://fsph.iupui.edu/academics/organizations/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Whether it’s Fairbanks’ very own Undergraduate Student Association or the Public Health Corps, there are several ways to get involved with student groups that are focused on public health!   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of medical and health services managers is projected to grow 28% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 56,600 openings for medical and health services managers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for Fairbanks School of Public Health graduates was $43,995, and the median salary was $45,800.  The national median annual salary for medical and health services managers was $101,340 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). ## Learn about our peer advisors   ### What is a peer advisor?  Peer advisors are students at IUPUI, just like you. They combine thorough training with their own student perspective and experience to offer you a complementary point of view to student success advisors.   ### What can peer advisors do for you?  Peer advisors provide drop-in advising services for University College students. Promoting academic success and campus resources, peer advisors are available to assist you with the following:   ### Our peer advisors  Abdullah Ali  Katie Devine  Jayma Girdler  Jakiyah Humphrey  Mahir Islam  Addison Lopian  Wendy Moreno

## Finding the career for your major  For some majors, the connection between what you study and what you do for a career (or at least where you will start your career) is fairly clear. Accounting majors generally work as accountants. As they begin their careers, nursing majors generally go on to work as nurses. Initially, education majors are usually found at the front of a classroom.  For other majors, the connection between what you study and what you eventually do for a career is not as direct. Psychology majors may go into a helping profession, but they could also land a job in an advertising firm. Philosophy majors may choose to be philosophers in the sense that they complete a Ph.D. in philosophy, or they could apply their skills in logic and analysis to a career in law. In these cases, what you do with your time outside the classroom (e.g., research, service, relevant work, internships, leadership) could have as much impact on your career path as your choice of major.  Whether you are exploring multiple majors or searching for information about your chosen field, we can help you connect majors to careers. Learn about the typical career areas and the types of employers that hire people with each major, as well as strategies to be a highly competitive candidate. Use this information to create your plan for success, and talk with us if you have questions!   ### Helpful resources  [What can I do with this major?](https://whatcanidowiththismajor.com/major)  [IU career guides](https://cdc.indiana.edu/career-guides/index.html)

# Milena Mileva  Student Success Advisor, HLS Cluster  Education:  Professional Experience  Advice to students: Keep an open mind. Embrace the challenges and the opportunities you will find in and outside the classroom. Seek change that will make you a better you—a more inquisitive, more resilient, at times even more vulnerable, lifelong learner. Start those self-talks (and then, the conversations you have with others) with the positives first—what went well, what good outcomes could be expected, what you appreciate the most. Staying positive will make the good times even more enjoyable and the hard times easier to get through.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: I would choose a cytotechnology major. I find it fascinating that with the technology we have today and the knowledge we continue to develop about the blueprint of our cells, we can not only detect emerging cancer at its earliest stage, but be proactive with choosing the optimal treatment for cure. Early detection of cancer is, quite literally, a matter of life and death.  Biography : I was born and raised in Bulgaria, a beautiful country hidden behind the Iron Curtain for too many decades. I come from a progressive family, highly invested in education and family values. My love for reading was nurtured by the desire to explore the world I was not allowed to travel. I loved walking the ancient Roman cobblestone streets or spending after-school hours with friends in the ancient Roman amphitheatre. My sense of belonging to the modern world was born when I came to IUPUI as a graduate student in 1998. I fell in love with the campus and the people. Today, Indiana is my home (and IUPUI—literally my home as I continue to spend the greater part of my days on campus). This is where I made lifelong friendships, where I am raising my son, where I share the joys of life with my husband, and cuddle with our cats. I love meeting new people, dining out with friends, cooking at home, and hopefully soon returning to Beef and Boards, and other theatres, for live shows and concerts. I love gardening and hiking out in my neighborhood parks. Traveling to new places, near and far, is always a thrilling and memorable experience.

# Addison Lopian  Peer Advisor  Advice to students: Take advantage of every opportunity that you can!  Brief bio : I am from Springfield, Illinois. I love reading, dancing, and exploring the city. I am in The Moving Company on campus, as well as Undergraduate Women in Science. My goal is to work in a forensics lab once I graduate from IUPUI.

## About the biomedical informatics major  Biomedical informatics is a major that focuses on using biomedical data and technology as tools to improve human health. You'll learn how to translate basic research into better health care solutions through computing. Through this major, you'll gain extensive knowledge in both biology and information technology.  Graduates of this major are prepared to work in the biomedical and genome research industry through. You may choose to pursue one of three tracts: bioinformatics, health informatics, or premedical bioinformatics.  Skills and abilities this major develops: biomedical data analysis, coding, research, computational biology, information management, analytical problem-solving skills, communication, and teamwork skills.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Luddy Indianapolis has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://luddy.iupui.edu/student-life/student-groups/)   #### Student organizations  Luddy Indianapolis has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Learn more through Luddy Indianapolis Career Services.](https://luddy.iupui.edu/careers/career-prep/)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Learn more through Luddy Indianapolis Career Services.  [Study abroad Study abroad allows you to learn, grow, and gain new skills. Luddy Indianapolis has two programs in Greece and Finland.](https://abroad.iupui.edu/)   #### Study abroad  Study abroad allows you to learn, grow, and gain new skills. Luddy Indianapolis has two programs in Greece and Finland.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of health information technologists is projected to grow 17% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 3,400 openings for health information technologists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Informatics and Computing graduates was $60,205, and the median was $55,000.  The national median annual salary for health information technologists was $55,560 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Technological advances come rapidly in the informatics field, so graduates often choose to pursue further education in a variety of fields, such as:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  I Investigative  R Realistic  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering (IT 475)](https://soic.iupui.edu/)   #### Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering  (IT 475)  [American Medical Informatics Association](https://www.aima.org/)  American Medical Informatics Association  [American Health Information Management Association](https://www.ahima.org/)  American Health Information Management Association   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster. ## About the social studies secondary education major  Social studies secondary education majors develop skills and knowledge in areas that include history, geography, government, sociology, and economics. You'll be able to apply what you learn through methods of teaching and learning with children from grades 5 through 12. You'll be in the field early during your studies and will be able to start learning in actual community classrooms. This major fully equips you to teach your own class of diverse students in any urban, suburban, or rural school.  Skills and abilities this major develops: cultural competency, teaching, problem solving, lesson planning, and inclusivity (IUPUI School of Education, 2019).  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## About the energy engineering major  Energy engineers discover valuable renewable energy sources that free us from dependency on quickly depleting materials. This broad field of engineering deals with energy efficiency, energy services, facility management, environmental compliance, and alternative energy technologies.  You'll take courses in chemistry, mechanical engineering, physics, and electrical engineering to create a strong knowledge base for work in the industry. Energy engineers apply their knowledge of science (physics and chemistry), engineering (electrical and mechanical), and economics to confront the global challenges of energy supply and demand.  Skills and abilities this major develops : critical thinking and problem solving skills, observational skills, creativity, communication skills, and attention to detail.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website. Academic and Career Development is committed to protecting your privacy and developing technology that gives you the most powerful and safe online experience. This Statement of Privacy applies to the Academic and Career Development Web site and governs data collection and usage. By using the Academic and Career Development website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.   ## Collection of your Personal Information  Academic and Career Development collects personally identifiable information, such as your e-mail address, name, home or work address or telephone number. Academic and Career Development also collects anonymous demographic information, which is not unique to you, such as your ZIP code, age, gender, preferences, interests and favorites.  There is also information about your computer hardware and software that is automatically collected by Academic and Career Development. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring Web site addresses. This information is used by Academic and Career Development for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the Academic and Career Development Web site.  Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through Academic and Career Development public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others. Note: Academic and Career Development does not read any of your private online communications.  Academic and Career Development encourages you to review the privacy statements of Web sites you choose to link to from Academic and Career Development so that you can understand how those Web sites collect, use and share your information. Academic and Career Development is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on Web sites outside of the Academic and Career Development and Academic and Career Development family of Web sites.   ## Use of your Personal Information  Academic and Career Development collects and uses your personal information to operate the Academic and Career Development Web site and deliver the services you have requested. Academic and Career Development also uses your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from Academic and Career Development and its affiliates. Academic and Career Development may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered.  Academic and Career Development does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. Academic and Career Development may, from time to time, contact you on behalf of external business partners about a particular offering that may be of interest to you. In those cases, your unique personally identifiable information (e-mail, name, address, telephone number) is not transferred to the third party. In addition, Academic and Career Development may share data with trusted partners to help us perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to Academic and Career Development, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information.  Academic and Career Development does not use or disclose sensitive personal information, such as race, religion, or political affiliations, without your explicit consent.  Academic and Career Development keeps track of the Web sites and pages our customers visit within Academic and Career Development, in order to determine what Academic and Career Development services are the most popular. This data is used to deliver customized content and advertising within Academic and Career Development to customers whose behavior indicates that they are interested in a particular subject area.  Academic and Career Development Web sites will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on Academic and Career Development or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of Academic and Career Development; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of Academic and Career Development, or the public.   ## Use of Cookies  The Academic and Career Development Web site use "cookies" to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a Web page server. Cookies cannot be used to run programs or deliver viruses to your computer. Cookies are uniquely assigned to you, and can only be read by a web server in the domain that issued the cookie to you.  One of the primary purposes of cookies is to provide a convenience feature to save you time. The purpose of a cookie is to tell the Web server that you have returned to a specific page. For example, if you personalize Academic and Career Development pages, or register with Academic and Career Development site or services, a cookie helps Academic and Career Development to recall your specific information on subsequent visits. This simplifies the process of recording your personal information, such as billing addresses, shipping addresses, and so on. When you return to the same Academic and Career Development Web site, the information you previously provided can be retrieved, so you can easily use the Academic and Career Development features that you customized.  You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to fully experience the interactive features of the Academic and Career Development services or Web sites you visit.   ## Security of your Personal Information  Academic and Career Development secures your personal information from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. Academic and Career Development secures the personally identifiable information you provide on computer servers in a controlled, secure environment, protected from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. When personal information (such as a credit card number) is transmitted to other Web sites, it is protected through the use of encryption, such as the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocol.   ## Changes to this Statement  Academic and Career Development will occasionally update this Statement of Privacy to reflect company and customer feedback. Academic and Career Development encourages you to periodically review this Statement to be informed of how Academic and Career Development is protecting your information.   ## Contact Information  Academic and Career Development welcomes your comments regarding this Statement of Privacy. If you believe that Academic and Career Development has not adhered to this Statement, please contact Academic and Career Development at nsbyrer@iupui.edu . We will use commercially reasonable efforts to promptly determine and remedy the problem

## About the community health major  Community health majors are prepared to work in entry-level positions in public health agencies, nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), hospitals, health care centers, and other organizations. They focus on the health and well-being of groups of people and individuals. These professionals often focus on health education and illness prevention.  Skills and abilities this major develops: research, teamwork and leadership, cultural competency, communication skills, ethical decision making, ability to analyze and evaluate, and knowledge of local and global health care systems.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Undergraduate research Much of public health work relies on solid data. Hone your research skills through an on-campus experience!](https://crl.iupui.edu)   #### Undergraduate research  Much of public health work relies on solid data. Hone your research skills through an on-campus experience!  [Study abroad Ever wanted to travel to Sweden? China? Colombia? There are many opportunities available through IU to study abroad and to gain insight into global health systems.](https://fsph.iupui.edu/academics/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Ever wanted to travel to Sweden? China? Colombia? There are many opportunities available through IU to study abroad and to gain insight into global health systems.  [Student organizations Whether it’s Fairbanks’ very own Undergraduate Student Association or the Public Health Corps, there are several ways to get involved with student groups that are focused on public health!](https://fsph.iupui.edu/academics/organizations/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Whether it’s Fairbanks’ very own Undergraduate Student Association or the Public Health Corps, there are several ways to get involved with student groups that are focused on public health!   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of health education specialists and community health workers is projected to grow 12% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 16,000 openings for health education specialists and community health workers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for Fairbanks School of Public Health graduates with a bachelor's degree was $42,764, and the median salary was $41,600.  The national median annual salary for health education specialists and community health workers was $48,860 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Community health majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  E Enterprising  A Artistic   ### Where to get more information  [Fairbanks School of Public Health](https://fsph.iupui.edu/)  Fairbanks School of Public Health  [American Public Health Association](https://www.apha.org/)  American Public Health Association  [Association for Community Health Improvement](http://www.healthycommunities.org/)  Association for Community Health Improvement   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster.  Learn about the HLS cluster  [Learn about the HLS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/hls/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Social work   ### School of Social Work  Graduates of the IU School of Social Work go on to promote social and economic justice at every level—from providing for the well-being of others to shaping social and economic policies. Since 1911, the school has been dedicated to developing competent, caring professionals who are qualified to assume leadership roles in social work practice and who strive to enrich the lives of the people they touch. The Council on Social Work Education accredits the Master of Social Work program at Indiana University (continuously since 1923).  Whether you want to begin a career in social work or are preparing for an advanced leadership role in practice, research, or policy development, the IU School of Social Work sets the standards for innovative and inspired social work education. In addition to social work, the school also serves as the home of the university's Labor Studies Program. With more than 60 years of leadership in the field of labor studies and labor education, Indiana University continues to pioneer innovative and quality educational opportunities in this field.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Degree planning sheet  Social work  [Social work](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/Ef3_a3yAgytFnXHYUM3agt0BE1x88xIkoCqG7Sg46qifHw?e=FVpTW3)   #### Major information  Social work  [Social work](https://socialwork.iupui.edu/BSW/)   #### Major-career connections  Social work   #### Get admitted to the School of Social Work   ##### Admission by application  Admission for the School of Social Work  [Admission for the School of Social Work](https://ssw.iu.edu/admissions/)   #### Home page  School of Social Work  [School of Social Work](http://iupui.socialwork.iu.edu/index.php)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## About the English major  English majors develop both analytical and creative thinking skills. You'll gain many transferable skills, including paying attention to detail, interpreting media, and understanding how people communicate through poetry, fiction, nonfiction, film, and speaking. You'll also apply what you learn through analysis by producing work of your own with concentrations like creative writing, linguistics, writing and literacy, films studies, and literature. English majors gain a general understanding of literature and writing, while also diving deep into an area of interest.  Skills and abilities this major develops : writing, critical thinking, analysis, communication, and meeting deadlines (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2018).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.  [Career services The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/cdo/)   #### Career services  The Office of Career Development prepares, supports, and advises students each step of their career paths—like finding internships and building your resume.  They serve undergraduate students, graduate students, and alumni.  [Study abroad Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Choose among programs in over 50 countries and nearly 20 languages, including English. Both shorter and longer immersion programs are also available.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of writers and authors is projected to grow 4% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 15,200 openings for writers and authors are projected each year, on average, over the decade.  Employment of communications and public relations managers is projected to grow 8% from 2021 to 2031, faster than the average for all occupations. About 9,100 openings for communications and public relations managers are projected each year, on average, over the decade.  Many of the openings mentioned above are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook, 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for graduates from the School of Liberal Arts with a bachelor's degree was $43,722, and the median was $38,900.  The national mean starting salary for liberal arts graduates who majored in English was $38,987 for the class of May 2020, according to the National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  English majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  A Artistic  S Social  E Enterprising   ### Where to get more information  [Department of English](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/departments/english/?) We work with you to learn and apply your values, interests, personality, and skills (VIPS) in discovering your individualized academic and career pathways.  We encourage exploratory students to engage in purposeful and productive co-curricular activities, such as research, study abroad, service learning, and internships, to prepare for the transition into the world of work.   ### Resources to explore majors and careers   #### Academic resources  [Exploratory degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/maps/view?mapId=333683ca-a318-400a-bcbb-8e7a701902f4)   #### Career resources  [Interest booklet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/ET0ZMGp8A3FPiGeG3i004iQBBUn1gMvOLGf6EJttVrmBug?e=zHGMPL)  [interest code sheet](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EY_9MIr7qHFFt-8fTYehBEoBMjKGjyK-cqP8lvIjG7VMvg?e=6jhBQ9)  [What can I do with this major?](https://whatcanidowiththismajor.com/)  [O*Net](https://www.onetonline.org/)  [O*Net interest profiler](https://www.mynextmove.org/explore/ip)  [Occupational Outlook Handbook](https://www.bls.gov/ooh/)   ### Our Exploratory team   #### Student success advisors  Suzanne Guinn  Maddy Saunders   #### Director  Mike Slocum   ### Connect with our cluster  Follow us on Instagram to get important updates and information! ## About the computer engineering technology major  Computer engineering technology students learn to develop and to implement computer applications used every day. From microprocessors to memory systems, software, and PCs—computers have revolutionized the way we live and work. Your knowledge can influence this everyday technology: handheld devices, networks, medical equipment, smartphones, robotics, and more. An engineering technology degree allows you to use new and emerging technology to install, service, and maintain software and hardware, as well as solve problems as part of a larger project.  Skills and abilities this major develops: troubleshooting; problem solving; math skills; application and design of hardware; conducting and interpreting experiments; utilizing systems and software programs; and installing, servicing, testing, repairing and maintaining computer systems.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of computer network engineers is projected to grow 4% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 11,800 openings for computer network engineers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Most of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for graduates from the School of Engineering and Technology with a bachelor's degree was $60,383, and the median was $60,320.  The national median annual salary for computer network engineers was $120,520 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Many computer engineering technology graduates continue their learning over the course of their careers to keep up with rapid advances in technology. They often obtain graduate degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  R Realistic  I Investigative  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [Purdue School of Engineering and Technology](https://et.iupui.edu/)  Purdue School of Engineering and Technology  [Association for Computing Machinery](https://www.acm.org/)  Association for Computing Machinery  [International Association of Science and Technology for Development](https://www.iasted.org/)  International Association of Science and Technology for Development   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Management B.S.P.A.   ### O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs  Only for students admitted to IUPUI prior to fall 2022. Other students should see “Management and Civic Leadership” for the new major.  You'll study government finance and budgets; economics and strategic planning; project management; human resource management; leadership and ethics; organization of government, nonprofit, and private organizations; and information technology management.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Management B.S.P.A.   #### Major information  Management  [Management](https://oneill.iupui.edu/academics/undergrad-degrees/management.html)   #### Get admitted to the O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs   ##### Admission requirements   ##### Home page  [O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs](https://oneill.iupui.edu)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

# Mike Slocum  Director of Career Development  [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mpslocum/)  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advice to students: Always ask questions. Always seek out resources. Remember not to compare the first chapter in your book to the tenth chapter in someone else's. And always come see your student success advisor and career consultant.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: I would be an exploratory major instead of changing my major as a junior and going to school for a fifth year to earn my degree. Our first choice is rarely our best choice.  Biography: I am originally from Culver, Indiana, but I have called Indianapolis my home now for over a decade. I enjoy rooting for the Colts and the Atlanta Braves, reading/listening to audiobooks, and binge-watching TV shows. I have also completed five half marathons and am training for a full marathon in 2023. I have been working with/for students for nearly 20 years and very much enjoy being part of the IUPUI and ACD family!

## About the medical imaging technology major  Medical imaging technologists work with patients undergoing interventional procedures (IR), computed tomography (CT), sonography (US), and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). These skilled imaging professionals use principles of radiation protection as they determine exposure factors and position patients for a variety of examinations with the use of computerized equipment.  To be admitted to the Medical Imaging Technology program, a student must be a licensed radiographer, nuclear medicine technologist, radiation therapist, sonographer, or hold an A.S. in Radiography. Many students earn their A.S. in Radiography at IUPUI first and then continue on to the B.S. in Medical Imaging Technology.  Skills and abilities this major develops: critical thinking and problem solving, use of technologies, knowledge of human anatomy and physiology, communication skills, and ability to be detail oriented.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Job shadow Shadowing a professional while they’re on the job is valuable for exploring careers. Some of the health professions programs also require observation hours as part of the application process.](https://hls.iupui.edu/plan/get-experience/index.html)   #### Job shadow  Shadowing a professional while they’re on the job is valuable for exploring careers. Some of the health professions programs also require observation hours as part of the application process.  [Undergraduate research Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career. Gaining research experience can be particularly helpful if you’re interested in clinical laboratory science or cytotechnology.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/undergraduate-research/index.html)   #### Undergraduate research  Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career. Gaining research experience can be particularly helpful if you’re interested in clinical laboratory science or cytotechnology.  [Professional work experience Working on campus can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  Working on campus can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of radiologic and MRI technologists is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, as fast as the average for all occupations. About 16,600 openings for radiologic and MRI technologists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2020, the average starting salary reported for School of Medicine graduates with a bachelor's degree was $57,035, and the median salary was $56,673 .  The national median salary for radiologic and MRI technologists was $61,980 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Medical imaging technology students often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  R Realistic  S Social  I Investigative  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [IU School of Medicine](https://medicine.iu.edu/undergraduate-health-professions)  IU School of Medicine  [American Society of Radiologic Technologists](https://www.asrt.org)  American Society of Radiologic Technologists  [Indiana Society of Radiologic Technologists](https://www.isort.org/)  Indiana Society of Radiologic Technologists   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster. ## Mathematics   ### School of Science  With a concentration in pure mathematics, students will be well prepared for a variety of careers in the mathematical sciences as well as for graduate work in mathematics. Pure math students have also been successful with graduate studies in other fields, including computer science, economics, engineering, law, medicine, and business.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Mathematics   #### Major information  Mathematics  [Mathematics](https://science.iupui.edu/academics/areas-of-study/math.html)   #### Get admitted to the School of Science   ##### Admission by certification  Admission for mathematics  [Admission for mathematics](https://science.iupui.edu/admissions/apply/index.html)   ##### Home page  School of Science  [School of Science](http://science.iupui.edu/)   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## International studies (co-major only)   ### Kelley School of Business  Students are required to complete a primary major within the Kelley School of Business in addition to pursuing the international studies major.  International business has evolved well past imports and exports. Many U.S. companies are multinational with production units in numerous foreign countries. Because of that, private enterprise in the United States has become more intimately concerned with the economic, political, and social trends of foreign nations. International studies majors at Kelley Indianapolis take on the challenges of doing business in the global marketplace by adding an international perspective to their primary majors.   #### Degree planning information  Current international dimension offerings may be found in your pre-business student Canvas site.   #### Get admitted to the Kelley School of Business   ##### Admission by certification  Current IUPUI students no longer have to submit an application to be admitted from University College to the Kelley School of Business Undergraduate Program. You'll be notified when the admission requirements are met. To certify into the Kelley School of Business from University College, you'll need to meet one of the sets of admission criteria . You'll be certified as soon as you meet either set of criteria.  [admission criteria](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EcwEAw_wtUVLuODPWHp7WM4Bojo7dz43egO1kg2giCZk9A?e=TmKTI6)   ##### Certification process   ### Home pages  [Kelley School of Business](https://kelley.iupui.edu/)  [International studies—major information](http://kelley.iupui.edu/undergrad/academics/majors/international-studies/)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management.  Learn about the EPP cluster  [Learn about the EPP cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/epp/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## About the elementary education major  As an elementary education major, you'll learn the methods of teaching and learning with children from kindergarten through sixth grade. This program will teach you how to make the most of challenges and opportunities in an urban school environment. You'll get out into the field early during your studies and start learning in the classroom.  Students are immersed in programs of study that challenge them intellectually with new models of instruction and explorations of diversity. At the conclusion of the program, you'll be fully equipped to teach your own class of diverse students in any urban, suburban, or rural school.  Skills and abilities this major develops : cultural competency, teaching, problem solving, lesson planning, and inclusivity (School of Education, 2019).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.](https://education.iupui.edu/student-experience/organizations.html)   #### Student organizations  Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.  [Service learning You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning.](https://education.iupui.edu/community-engagement/index.html)   #### Service learning  You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning.  [Study abroad Study abroad is much more than a trip—it’s an intellectual and cultural adventure that will change the way you see the world, other people, and yourself.](https://abroad.iupui.edu/)   #### Study abroad  Study abroad is much more than a trip—it’s an intellectual and cultural adventure that will change the way you see the world, other people, and yourself.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of kindergarten and elementary school teachers is projected to grow 4% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 120,300 openings for kindergarten and elementary school teachers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for School of Education graduates with a bachelor's degree was $41,859, and the median was $42,830.  The national median annual salary for elementary school teachers, except special education teachers, was $61,400 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Education majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These career options require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  E Enterprising  A Artistic   ### Where to get more information  [School of Education](https://education.iupui.edu/)  School of Education  [IUPUI Elementary Urban Educators](https://twitter.com/EUE_IUPUI)  IUPUI Elementary Urban Educators  [American Federation of Teachers](https://www.aft.org/)  American Federation of Teachers   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Motorsports engineering   ### School of Engineering and Technology  IUPUI is the first university in the United States to offer a bachelor's degree in motorsports engineering. This four-year Bachelor of Science in Motorsports Engineering was approved in 2008. This program prepares graduates for careers in the motorsports industry, as well as automotive-related companies. The focus is on teaching fundamentals of engineering and includes hands-on projects that involve designing, analyzing, and building of actual systems.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Furniture design   ### Herron School of Art and Design  Woodworking is the foundation for Herron’s furniture design program with an emphasis on designing, building, and making unique pieces using both traditional and contemporary tools and processes. F urniture design students are encouraged to participate in the national conversation of furniture design at workshops, symposiums, and conferences. Herron students often compete in national design competitions and are regularly recognized for their work.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Explore with us during Field Trip Fridays  We are excited to continue field trips for fall 2023. J oin Academic and Career Development (ACD) staff to explore new employers, academic programs, and other career development opportunities!  Students from all majors are invited to join us on Field Trip Fridays. Registration is required. Be sure to stay tuned as we finalize our future opportunities!  If you have any questions, please contact Mike Slocum , director of career development.   ### Upcoming field trips  Date  Location (click to register)  Time  What you can expect  October 20, 2023  Indianapolis International Airport  Register here  [Register here](https://events.iu.edu/fcw/event/1157913-field-trip-friday-explore-federal-careers)  11:00 a.m. –3:30 p.m.  Interested in careers with the federal government? Want to know what career opportunities are available and how to get started? Join us when multiple organizations will speak with students about their organizations and how to get started with a career in the federal government!    Federal organizations who will be represented are:    Lunch and parking validations will be provided.  October 27, 2023  Indiana Statehouse  Register here  [Register here](https://events.iu.edu/fcw/event/1181959-field-trip-friday-rescheduled-indiana-statehouse)  10:00 a.m.–12:00 p.m.  The Indiana Statehouse is more than a beautiful old building. It’s the home of dozens of different ways to work within state government. Come take a tour of this historic site, learn from early career professionals in state government, and find out how you can intern with the State of Indiana and become a future state employee!  The next round of internship opportunities are live and due October 31. Here are just two!  Intern with House Democrats  [Intern with House Democrats](https://indianahousedemocrats.org/student-opportunities/internships)  Intern with House Republicans  [Intern with House Republicans](https://www.indianasenaterepublicans.com/intern-program)  We will walk over from campus as a group, or you may pay for street parking at the building, if available.  November 3, 2023  Indianapolis Motor Speedway  Register here  [Register here](https://events.iu.edu/fcw/event/1185653-field-trip-friday-indianapolis-motor-speedway)    10:00 a.m.–12:00 p.m.  Indianapolis Motor Speedway (IMS). The Brickyard. The Speedway. The Track. Whatever you call it, it’s known as the home of the Greatest Spectacle in Racing!  And they will be hosting IUPUI students to attend their Career and College Experience program.  If you’re interested in careers at IMS, some majors represented will be:  November 10, 2023  Irsay Family YMCA  Register here  [Register here](https://events.iu.edu/fcw/event/1185654-field-trip-friday-irsay-family-ymca)  10:00 a.m.–12:00 p.m.  Are you interested in the careers and majors found at the Irsay Family YMCA?
