You'll learn about how multiple staff found their paths to IndyGo, as well as tour the headquarters.  March 28  IU School of Medicine—Health Professions Programs  [IU School of Medicine—Health Professions Programs](https://medicine.iu.edu/undergraduate-health-professions)  10:00 a.m.–12:00 p.m.  Ultrasound, nuclear medicine technology, radiography? # Jakiyah Humphrey  Peer Advisor  Work or involvement experience while at IUPUI: 21st Century Scholar Peer Advisor  Advice to students: The best habit to break is procrastination, because once you stop playing with your time, others around you will value it more.  Brief bio : Keep your mind open in life! It's the only way to expand and grow. You'll never know what you don't like until you try it, and it's best to know that you tried something and didn't like it versus having the thought of what it would have been like to try lingering in your mind (this goes for ANYTHING in life).

## Health and Life Sciences  The Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster prepares students to pursue majors and careers in the diverse and exciting world of health care. HLS majors can explore careers in patient care, laboratory work, health care administration, and health education.  Around 75% of HLS majors are interested in direct patient care programs, all of which are competitive and application based, so HLS advisors and our career consultant help students carefully plan their schedules; prepare their applications; and create smart, personalized parallel plans and career goals that align with each student’s values, interests, personality, and skills. We also work with current IUPUI students who are not pursuing degrees through the School of Science to prepare for a professional school in health care. Pre-professional health programs include medicine, dentistry, optometry, physical therapy, physician assistant, occupational therapy, pharmacy, chiropractic, and even veterinary medicine. Whether you are an exercise science major wanting to become a physical therapist, a business major wanting to pursue dentistry, or a journalism major looking to be a chiropractor, we can help you prepare for professional school and achieve your goals.   ### Our HLS team   ### Student success advisors  Mikayla Bucio  Erica Gleason  Grace Klosterman  Milena Mileva  Lisa Smith  Patricia Thacker ## Strategizing your success  Student success advisors and career consultants are here to help you map out your journey to graduation. You should meet with a student success advisor to make sure you are on track to transition into your degree-granting school. Student success advisors and career consultants will also encourage and help you strategize for your success.   ### Student success advisors  Student success advisors help you determine which courses to take each semester, ensure you are meeting degree requirements, and help you understand the processes of applying and transitioning to your degree-granting school.   ### Career consultants  Career consultants help you articulate which major is the best fit for you and help you explore career options that will match your personality, interests, and strengths. Sit down with a career consultant for one hour to start exploring major and career options that align with your interests and strengths.   ### Get what you need   #### Declare or update your major  When you are ready, you can complete the web form to declare (or update) your major.   #### Holds  You'll want to have holds on your record released before your enrollment date for the next term to ensure access to the most options of classes and times.   #### Academic tools  If you need to register for classes, find your unofficial transcript, calculate your GPA, or check your degree progress, see Academic Tools.   #### Four-year plan  See the four-year plan to help you visualize your journey to graduation.  Our staff works in specialized clusters to offer focused information on degree programs. Learn more about your team in Academic and Career Development.   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## About the psychology major  Psychology is the scientific study of behavior and mental processes. The goals of psychology are to describe, explain, predict, and change behavior (observable actions) and mental processes (thoughts, feelings, beliefs, and memories) through research and applied knowledge. Overall, the goal of psychology is to improve the quality of life. Specialities of IUPUI psychology faculty include psychobiology of addictions, health psychology, industrial/organizational psychology, severe mental illness, stereotyping, and prejudice.  Skills and abilities this major develops: communication skills, critical thinking, understanding and appreciation of ethics and diversity, investigative and quantitative skills, and scientific methodology.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Undergraduate research Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.](https://science.iupui.edu/research/student-opportunities/index.html)   #### Undergraduate research  Undergraduate research experiences help you develop important problem-solving skills and experience for your future career.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources.](https://iu.instructure.com/enroll/6E3KLT)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships or part-time jobs. Join the School of Science Career and Internship site in Canvas for additional information and resources.  [Center for Service and Learning The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways.](https://csl.iupui.edu/)   #### Center for Service and Learning  The IUPUI Center for Service and Learning has many service-oriented programs that allow you to work with and impact your community in endless ways.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of psychologists is projected to grow 6% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 14,100 openings for psychologists are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Science graduates was $45,303, and the median salary was $40,000.  The national median annual salary for psychologists was $81,040 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Some psychology graduates pursue graduate or professional school to work in areas such as:  Others obtain graduate degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  I Investigative  A Artistic  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [Department of Psychology](https://science.iupui.edu/psychology/)  Department of Psychology  [American Psychological Association](https://www.apa.org/)  American Psychological Association  [psychology.org](https://www.psychology.org/)  psychology.org   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  [Learn about the STEM cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/stem/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## Religious studies   ### School of Liberal Arts  Religion is basic to the human experience. For thousands of years, people have turned to religious traditions to answer life’s most important questions. Yet only with the birth of modern research universities did scholars begin to study religion from an objective, nonsectarian perspective. The field of religious studies is dedicated to understanding the dimensions and patterns of religions across cultures and historical contexts. Students learn how religions shape individuals' views of the world; create and sustain the communities in which we live; and interact with politics, economics, literature and the arts, and other structures of society.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Religious studies   #### Major information  Religious studies  [Religious studies](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/relstudies/pages/for-students/major.php)   #### Get admitted to the School of Liberal Arts   ##### Admission by certification  Have you met the certification requirements? Let Liberal Arts know.  [Let Liberal Arts know.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/admissions/update-major-form.html)   ##### Home page  School of Liberal Arts  [School of Liberal Arts](http://liberalarts.iupui.edu/)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)

## Our guiding principles  Throughout the spring 2017 semester and through the work of three mini-retreats, expectations were established for all of Academic and Career Development (ACD). The concepts within The Speed of Trust by Stephen Covey were discussed in addition to setting expectations for how we would work together moving forward. The result of these three meetings was the ACD principles below.  We will:   ### How we use these principles  To keep these principles at the forefront of our work, they will be utilized from the hiring process to weekly staff meetings and through the annual performance management process.

## Healthcare engineering technology management   ### School of Engineering and Technology  If you are interested in interacting with patients, staff, and technology in the medical field, consider the healthcare engineering technology management major. In this career, your daily activities will be to manage and to support the manufacturing and the use of existing medical devices and technology in patient care. You may also work on the project management side, helping hospitals or facilities plan their technology needs and training practitioners. You will work in an area where putting your mind and hands to work will make a visible impact in the high-tech world of medicine.  Students can complete the 67 credit associate degree first, get a job, and then continue pursuing the bachelor's degree while working. The Bureau of Labor Statistics expects an increase in job opportunities in this field, and salaries are high, making this a great job for those who want to make a difference in health care.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Healthcare engineering and technology management  [Healthcare engineering and technology management](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/major-career-connections/healthcare-engineering-management-studies-career-connection.html)   #### Major information  Healthcare engineering management technology  [Healthcare engineering management technology](https://et.iupui.edu/departments/ent/programs/hetm/)   #### Get admitted to the School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Admission requirements  Learn more about HETM  [Learn more about HETM](https://et.iupui.edu/departments/ent/programs/hetm/)   ##### Home page  [School of Engineering and Technology](http://www.engr.iupui.edu/)   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster in the Office of Academic and Career Development is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing areas. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the STEM cluster  Learn about other clusters

## About the visual communication design major  Visual communication design has the capacity to benefit business and society, and the designer plays a pivotal role in that process. The visual communication design program allows you to study a wide range of design principles and visual communication theory and history. You'll learn the evolving nature of emerging technologies and discuss relevant theories while undertaking real-world practical projects.  As a student, you'll gain valuable experience working collaboratively with:  Skills and abilities this major develops: technical skills, design, problem solving, project management, and personal branding (Herron School of Art and Design, 2019).  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Student organizations  Herron’s student organizations will help you build professional and personal relationships within your discipline.  [Career services Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)   #### Career services  Guidance from Herron Career Services is tailored to your needs at all levels throughout your journey—including internship and networking with alumni.  [Study abroad Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/study-abroad/index.html)   #### Study abroad  Herron's study abroad programs are a powerful way  to discover the historical impact of art and design in the world and over time while making memorable friendships.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of graphic designers is projected to grow 3% from 2021 to 2031, slower than the average for all occupations. Despite limited employment growth, about 24,800 openings for graphic designers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for visual communication design graduates with a B.F.A. was $40,542, and the median salary was $43,680.  The national median annual salary for graphic designers was $50,710 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Visual communication design majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *This career requires additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  A Artistic  E Enterprising  S Social  [Get your interest code](https://acd.iupui.edu/explore/choose-your-major/connect-majors-to-careers/interests/index.html?)   ### Where to get more information  [Herron School of Art and Design (HR 126 or 317-278-9400)](https://herron.iupui.edu/)   #### Herron School of Art and Design  (HR 126 or 317-278-9400)  [Professional Association for Design](https://www.aiga.org/)  Professional Association for Design  [Herron Career Services](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)  Herron Career Services   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. ## Early childhood education   ### School of Education  The IU School of Education at IUPUI prepares exemplary teachers for today's and tomorrow's diverse schools. The Bachelor of Science in Early Childhood Education program is designed for early childhood educators interested in developing the skills necessary to effectively empower, engage, and educate diverse learners in a variety of urban education settings, in both the private and public sectors. In consideration of the full spectrum of early childhood and the professional aspirations of students, there are two options for program completion: nonlicensure and licensure. The nonlicensure option is for educators interested in working in early childhood settings focused on birth to pre–K. The licensure option is for educators interested in working in early childhood settings focused on pre–K to Grade 3 and results in early childhood education licensure (grades P–3) by the state of Indiana.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. # Chris Maroldo  Director of Academic Success  Education:  Professional Experience :  Advice to students: Don’t be afraid to ask for help, either from your professors, academic advisors, or friends who want the best for you.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: Philanthropic studies. This is a fairly recent major, and the Lilly Family School of Philanthropy is the world’s first school of its kind. I would be thrilled to be one of the first graduates from this program, in part, due to the nonprofit sector. I enjoy giving back to my local community in different ways. Change begins at home and works out from there.

## About the fitness management and personal training major  Fitness management and personal training students gain an in-depth knowledge of movement, physical activity programming, and nutrition. The program is a combination of general and core coursework and includes field internship experience that prepares you for a variety of careers and work environments in the fitness industry. In addition, you'll be provided with the theory and practical training skills that are needed to be eligible to sit for professional fitness certifications from national organizations, such as the American College of Sports Medicine and the National Strength and Conditioning Association.  Skills and abilities this major develops : knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and nutrition; successful communication skills; ability to think critically and problem solve; management and leadership training; and an understanding of diversity.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Community engagement The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.](https://shhs.iupui.edu/community/index.html)   #### Community engagement  The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.  [Professional work experience Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.  [Life–Health Sciences Internship Program LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.](https://lhsi.iupui.edu/)   #### Life–Health Sciences Internship Program  LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of fitness trainers and instructors is projected to grow 19% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. About 65,500 openings for fitness trainers and instructors are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for School of Health and Human Sciences graduates was $35,485, and the median salary was $33,280.  The median annual salary for fitness trainers and instructors was $40,700 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Fitness management and personal training students often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  S Social  R Realistic  E Enterprising   ### Where to get more information  [School of Health and Human Sciences](https://shhs.iupui.edu/)  School of Health and Human Sciences  [National Strength and Conditioning Association](https://www.nsca.com/)  National Strength and Conditioning Association  [American Council on Exercise](https://www.acefitness.org/)  American Council on Exercise   ### Health and Life Sciences Cluster  This major belongs to the Health and Life Sciences (HLS) cluster.  Learn about the HLS cluster  [Learn about the HLS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/hls/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## About the mechanical engineering technology major  Mechanical engineering technology students put knowledge into action, developing skills in generating and using mechanical and fluid energy, developing machines and products, production processes, installing and maintaining machines, and solving repetitive engineering problems. An engineering technology degree is different than engineering because class and laboratory work focus on applications. As you learn theories of how things work, you'll apply them in immediate, relevant ways.  Skills and abilities this major develops: mechanical skills, detail orientation, math skills (for analysis, design and troubleshooting), creativity, and communication skills.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/organizations/)   #### Student organizations  ET has many student organizations, which are a great way to build your skills, network, and grow as a professional.  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/careers/students/internships-and-co-ops)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, co-op, or part-time jobs.  [Study abroad ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.](https://et.iupui.edu/students/studyabroad/)   #### Study abroad  ET has many program-specific study abroad opportunities—a great way to gain cultural competency and grow your skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of mechanical engineering technologists and technicians is projected to grow 2% from 2021 to 2031, slower than the average for all occupations. Despite limited employment growth, about 4,200 openings for mechanical engineering technologists and technicians are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for m echanical engineering technology graduates was $64,650, and the median salary was $61,650.  The national median salary for mechanical engineering technologists and technicians was $60,460 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Mechanical engineering technology graduates often choose to pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  R Realistic  I Investigative  C Conventional   ### Where to get more information  [Purdue School of Engineering and Technology](https://et.iupui.edu/)  Purdue School of Engineering and Technology  [American Society of Mechanical Engineers](https://www.asme.org/)  American Society of Mechanical Engineers  [Engineering Technology Accreditation](https://www.nicet.org/certification-programs/)  Engineering Technology Accreditation   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools. ## About the management B.S.B. major  Management is the study of leadership for the day-to-day operations of a business as well as the future direction a business may go to continue its stated mission. You'll motivate employees, build teams, shape corporate cultures, allocate people and resources, and create strategies to improve operations and achieve business goals. You'll also study a broad range of business topics and specializations to gain a big picture understanding of the corporate world.  Skills and abilities this major develops : leadership, team-building, strategic planning, and resource allocation.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Connect with other students and future employers,  build leadership and teamwork skills, and have a great time doing it!](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/student-life/student-organizations.html)   #### Student organizations  Connect with other students and future employers,  build leadership and teamwork skills, and have a great time doing it!  [Professional work experience Grow your skills through internships, part-time jobs, or co-op programs. Connect with the Kelley career services team to make an appointment.](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/careers.html)   #### Professional work experience  Grow your skills through internships, part-time jobs, or co-op programs. Connect with the Kelley career services team to make an appointment.  [Study abroad “Business without Borders”—Kelley Indianapolis has programs available in London, Paris, Vienna, Prague, and Italy. Opportunities are also available through Kelley Bloomington’s study abroad program.](https://kelley.iupui.edu/programs/undergraduate/student-life/study-abroad.html)   #### Study abroad  “Business without Borders”—Kelley Indianapolis has programs available in London, Paris, Vienna, Prague, and Italy. Opportunities are also available through Kelley Bloomington’s study abroad program.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of management analysts is projected to grow 11% from 2021 to 2031, much faster than the average for all occupations. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for business graduates with a bachelor's degree was $53,325, and the median salary was $52,000.  The national median annual salary for management analysts was $93,000 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). I graduated from Southport High School. I have a bulldog named Stella.

## About the physical education teacher education major  The physical education teacher education major is for students who would like to teach physical education, wellness, or health at the K–12 level. The curriculum provides content knowledge and practical experiences to prepare students for a career in teaching and youth development.  Along with coursework in the School of Education at IUPUI, the curriculum prepares students for the teacher licensing examination in this content area specialty. Students have opportunities to gain teaching experience in multiple local community or school settings.  Skills and abilities this major develops: knowledge of motor learning and behavioral learning stages, classroom management techniques, basics of first aid and emergency care, and cultural competencies.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Community engagement The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.](https://shhs.iupui.edu/community/index.html)   #### Community engagement  The School of Health and Human Sciences hosts a number of initiatives for students to get involved, add to their resume, and give back to the community.  [Professional work experience Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/opportunities/professional-work-experiences/index.html)   #### Professional work experience  Working on campus for offices such as Campus Recreation or the Office of Health and Wellness can provide great preparation for a variety of health-related careers.  [Life–Health Sciences Internship Program LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.](https://lhsi.iupui.edu/)   #### Life–Health Sciences Internship Program  LHSI is a paid internship program that places second- and third-year IUPUI students in a variety of health and science workplaces to gain practical experience and skills.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of high school teachers is projected to grow 5% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 77,900 openings for high school teachers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Education graduates was $41,859, and the median salary was $42,830.  The national median annual salary for high school teachers was $61,820 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). # Sarah Eltzroth  Director of Operations  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advice to students: Own your college experience—all of the ups and downs—but don’t think that means to go at it alone. Having a strong support network is critical, especially when things get tough.  Biography: I was raised in a military family, growing up primarily overseas in Belgium, Japan, and Germany. I love to travel and save every penny I can to make it happen. When I’m not at work, I enjoy hiking, napping in hammocks, car singing, yoga, board games, and spending time with family and my two rambunctious rescue dogs, Putter and Daphne. My favorite things to learn about include almost anything related to history, culture, environmentalism, linguistics, and food.

## Management B.S.B.   ### Kelley School of Business  Coaches and collaborators, diplomats and directors, teachers and taskmasters—today’s managers motivate, develop, and move people and projects up the ladder of business success. At Kelley Indianapolis, you'll learn what it means to manage efficiently and effectively across industries as you tackle real challenges from real companies that are looking for fresh ways to motivate employees, build teams, shape corporate cultures, allocate people and resources, and create strategies to improve operations and to achieve business goals.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  View degree map  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Degree planning information  Current international dimension offerings may be found in your pre-business student Canvas site.   #### Major-career connections  Management   #### Get admitted to the Kelley School of Business   ##### Admission by certification  Current IUPUI students no longer have to submit an application to be admitted from University College to the Kelley School of Business Undergraduate Program. You'll be notified when the admission requirements are met. To certify into the Kelley School of Business from University College, you'll need to meet one of the sets of admission criteria . You'll be certified as soon as you meet either set of criteria.  [admission criteria](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EcwEAw_wtUVLuODPWHp7WM4Bojo7dz43egO1kg2giCZk9A?e=TmKTI6)   ##### Certification process   ##### Home pages  [Kelley School of Business](https://kelley.iupui.edu/)  [Kelley—majors information](http://kelley.iupui.edu/undergrad/academics/majors/)   ### Enterprise, Policy, and Planning Cluster  This major is part of the Enterprise, Policy, and Planning (EPP) cluster. The EPP cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing or interested in business; economics; labor studies; organizational leadership; public and environmental affairs; sport management; and tourism, conventions, and event management. ## About the math teaching major  As a mathematics education major, you'll learn the methods of educating students from grades 5 through 12. Students pursuing this degree complete all the classes required for a mathematics major, including applied mathematics, statistics, and pure mathematics, in addition to education courses.  Mathematicians use mathematical theory, computational techniques, algorithms, and the latest computer technology to solve economic, scientific, engineering, physics, and business problems. Students will graduate with all the skills and knowledge needed to pursue a career in middle schools or high schools after passing state exams (School of Education, 2019).  Skills and abilities this major develops : cultural competency, teaching, problem solving, and quantitative.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## About the radiography major  Radiologic technology is a science involving the medical use of X-rays in the diagnosis of disease. Principal duties consist of performing X-ray examinations of patients. Radiographers must be able to handle seriously ill and injured patients to obtain the maximum amount of information without injury to the patient and with the least amount of pain and discomfort from the examination. They may assist the radiologist in some complex procedures, often involving the injection of opaque media through needles or catheters.  Skills and abilities this major develops: communication skills, active listening techniques, use of appropriate technologies, attention to detail, and an intimate knowledge of human anatomy.  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Some of the health professions programs also require observation hours as part of the application process.](https://hls.iupui.edu/plan/get-experience/index.html)   #### Job shadow  Shadowing a professional while they’re on the job is valuable for exploring careers. ## American sign language/English interpreting   ### School of Liberal Arts  Effective fall 2023: changes to this major are no longer accepted.  Interpreting for people who do not speak a common language is a linguistic and social act of communication. An interpreter relays messages and manages the process of talking back and forth for two people who speak different languages. An interpreter’s role is an engaged one, aimed at an overall understanding of the entire communicative situation, requiring fluency in the languages, the ability to know how meaning is constructed, and skills in managing the cross-cultural flow of talk.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  American sign language/English interpreting   #### Major information  American sign language  [American sign language](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/wlac/pages/undergraduate-programs-folder/american%20sign%20language.php#rtab1)   #### Get admitted to the School of Liberal Arts   ##### Admission by application  Application information  [Application information](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/wlac/pages/undergraduate-programs-folder/american%20sign%20language.php#rtab5)   ##### Home page  School of Liberal Arts  [School of Liberal Arts](http://liberalarts.iupui.edu/)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. ## Assessments  Assessments can help you increase your self-awareness. Your answers to the questions asked in each assessment below will help you identify your values , interests , personality traits , and skills. You'll see your preferences start to emerge.  Don't assume you'll have an instant answer. You'll need to review the information, reflect, and continue to research. If you need a place to start, assessments can help you target majors and careers that will be satisfying. Talk to us to learn more, or jump in on your own!   ### Focus  Focus on your values, interests, personality, and skills using this free resource.   ### Assessments  Learn about the benefits of the Strong Interest Inventory or the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator by talking with your career consultant.   ### Additional Assessments  Here are additional free assessments that can help you identify your interests:  [Indiana Resource Center](http://www.learnmoreindiana.org/)  Indiana Resource Center  [Career interests game (Univ. of Missouri)](http://career.missouri.edu/career-interest-game)  Career interests game (Univ. of Missouri)  [KnowHow2Go](http://knowhow2go.acenet.edu/)  KnowHow2Go  [My Next Move](http://www.mynextmove.org/)  My Next Move  [CareerOneStop](https://www.careeronestop.org/GetMyFuture/default.aspx)  CareerOneStop

## About the cybersecurity major  The cybersecurity major will prepare you to enter the workforce in the rapidly advancing field of cybersecurity. The Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity will enable you to address the security challenges and risks that all industries encounter daily. Cybersecurity is a multidisciplinary area—a combination of information technology, computing, and engineering.  This program will provide a solid, comprehensive background in the related topics of cybersecurity engineering and their applications. With more companies in all industries increasingly relying on technology for their operations, cybersecurity is a rapidly growing field.  Skills and abilities this major develops: problem solving, abstract thinking, malware analysis and reversing, risk analysis, risk mitigation, security data analytics, cloud security, and more.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website. ## Holds for University College students  University College academic advising holds will prevent you from registering for classes for the next term until you meet with your student success advisor. The purpose of these holds is to initiate a conversation between you and your advisor about your successful progress at IUPUI.  You should have holds on your record released before your enrollment date for the next term to ensure access to the most options for classes and times.   ### Types of advising holds   #### Advising (V03)  During their first semester at IUPUI, all new students are expected to meet and to discuss their plans for the next term with their student success advisor. The goal is to ensure you have the information and tools you need to successfully plan your education and to navigate IUPUI.  No enrollment is allowed in the next term until the hold is released.  To release the hold, you must make an appointment with one of the student success advisors in your cluster to discuss your transition to IUPUI, to review your academic and career goals, and to develop a plan for coursework in future semesters.  NOTE: If you are a freshman in a first-year seminar (FYS), the student success advisor in your FYS may provide you information about scheduling an appointment to clear the advising hold.  Details are emailed to your university email account when this hold has been added to your record.   #### Academic/transition (V06)  To ensure that all undergraduate students make appropriate progress toward completion of a degree, University College students who started at IUPUI as beginning freshmen are required to enter a degree-granting program by the time they earn 60 credit hours.  No enrollment is allowed in the next term until the hold is updated.  To release the hold, you must make an appointment with one of the student success advisors in your cluster to review your academic and career goals, to develop a plan for coursework in future semesters, and to develop a plan for admission to your degree-granting program.  Details are emailed to your university email account when this hold has been added to your record.  Once you are fully admitted to your degree-granting program, the hold will be fully removed.   #### Sophomore exploratory (V26)  To ensure timely progress toward completion of a degree, you should declare an intended major by the time you have completed 30 credit hours. If you are an exploratory major and have 30 or more credit hours, you will need to go through major and career exploration.  No enrollment is allowed in the next term until the hold is updated.  To release the hold, you must make an appointment with one of the exploratory student success advisors about major and career exploration.  Details are emailed to your university email account when this hold has been added to your record.   #### Academic probation (V00)  Students whose cumulative GPA is below a 2.0 are put on academic probation. We want you to be successful and are here to help in any way. We believe the probation program will help you achieve your educational goals.  No enrollment is allowed in the next term until the hold is updated.  To release the hold, you must make an appointment with one of the student success advisors in your cluster to review your academic and career goals, develop a plan for success for the current (and future) semesters, connect you with a mandatory mentoring program, and develop a course plan for future semesters.  Additional details are emailed to your university email account when this hold has been added to your record.   #### Dismissal (V02)  When your cumulative GPA fails to meet our retention standards, you'll be academically dismissed from University College. Students who have been dismissed from the university are not able to enroll in classes at IUPUI for at least the next fall or spring term following the academic dismissal.  No enrollment is allowed on any IU campus (multi-institutional).  Students must follow the procedures and petition for reinstatement. Details can be found under About, click on Policies, and then Academic Reinstatement.   #### Register one term only (V12)  Once reinstated after academic dismissal, you will be removed from the dismissal hold and added to the register-one-term-only hold. The goal is to ensure you have continued support in your return to IUPUI and to help you continue working on your plan for academic success.  No enrollment is allowed in the next term until the hold is updated.  Until you achieve good standing (a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher) or until you are admitted to your degree-granting program (whichever comes first), you are required to have an appointment with a student success advisor in your cluster each semester. At this appointment, you will review current academic progress and resources and develop a plan for the upcoming semester.   ### How to find a hold  A hold can be placed on your record for reasons including but not limited to: past due encumbrance (e.g., parking tickets, library fines, tuition payments), academic standards, failure to meet immunization requirements, required academic advising, missing admission credentials, or noncompliance with other university regulations or obligations.  A hold on your record can impact one or more of the following:  To check if a hold has been placed on your record, log into One and follow these steps:  [One](https://one.iu.edu/)  Depending on the type of hold, you may need to contact Academic and Career Development, the Health Life Sciences Advising Center, or even a different office.  All academic holds placed by University College require an advising appointment .

## About the tourism, conventions, and event management major  This major focuses on managing and operating places where people travel to eat, attend special events, and relax or have fun. In addition to studying the hospitality and travel industry, you'll also complete a general business certificate as part of the degree. Internships are required, and opportunities include both local and out-of-state sites.  Skills and abilities this major develops: event planning, management, marketing, communication, organization, and promotion.  Print page   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. ## Chemistry   ### School of Science  Chemistry is the study of the basic structural units of matter—what things are made of, what their properties are, and how they act and interact. Chemical biology applies logic and methods from chemistry to the study of complex and challenging questions in biology. To a significant extent, interest in chemical biology has been inspired by the growth of the biotechnology industry. Chemistry plays an integral role in today's scientific endeavors. As science has become increasingly interdisciplinary, fundamental scientific problems focus on the chemical nature of matter.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Chemistry   #### Major information  Chemistry  [Chemistry](https://science.iupui.edu/academics/areas-of-study/chemistry.html)   #### Get admitted to the School of Science   ##### Admission by certification  Admission for chemistry  [Admission for chemistry](https://science.iupui.edu/admissions/apply/index.html)   ##### Home page  School of Science  [School of Science](http://science.iupui.edu/)   ### Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Cluster  This major belongs to the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) cluster. The STEM cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in the sciences, technology, engineering, informatics, and computing. The STEM cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools. # Dee Alderman  Career Consultant, STEM Cluster  [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dee-alderman-2754a971/)  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advice to students: Make sure you make your coursework a priority, but not your only priority. Get involved on campus and join a club or organization. Do not be afraid to ask for help when you need it and offer it when you can give it.  Additionally, if your Plan A isn't what you thought it would be, don't be afraid to explore Plan B, C, or even D. Meet with your advisor or career consultant to explore options!  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: I would study environmental science. I am fascinated with this degree because, as an avid gardener, I know how environmental issues affect every aspect of our being via what we consume. Being able to study how to prevent pollution and contamination and how to clean those areas already polluted is so very important and would be rewarding to me.  Biography: Although I was born in Brazil, Indiana, I have lived in many different places, from Pennsylvania to Kansas and most places in between! I just tell people I am from the country. Once we moved back to Indiana, I lived in a very rural setting on a small farm. I enjoy gardening . . . growing vegetables, flowers don’t stand a chance around me! I have a small nonprofit community garden. I love to “put up” (e.g., can, freeze, dehydrate) what I grow. I also enjoy spending weekends at our RV on the lake where the whole family can decompress and unplug. I am a wife, a mom to three daughters and one son, and a Grammy to one grandson and four granddaughters! Oh, I also have my baby, a La-Chon (Lhasa Apso-Bichon Frise mix) named Harold.

## Making major and career decisions  Successfully choosing a major and planning for a career is a process. Academic and Career Development is here to support you. We offer the encouragement and resources you need to create a plan that prepares you for academic and career success. Get started today!  As you work through the process of career exploration, your preferences will start to emerge. However, thinking through it isn't enough. You have to take action and create a plan.  There is a lot you can do beyond the degree. To be as competitive as possible, consider the skills and expertise valued by employers in your field. Maybe you could benefit from a minor in Spanish or a certificate in network security. Outside the classroom, set yourself apart by gaining experience. Your time at IUPUI can offer amazing opportunities—in our community or across the world. You just have to create your plan.   ### More on career planning  [Occupational Outlook Handbook The Occupational Outlook Handbook can provide career information on duties, education and training, pay, and outlook for hundreds of occupations.](https://www.bls.gov/ooh/)   #### Occupational Outlook Handbook  The Occupational Outlook Handbook can provide career information on duties, education and training, pay, and outlook for hundreds of occupations.  [O*NET O*NET offers in-depth information on occupations with a focus on the knowledge, skills, and abilities needed for various positions. You can search careers by a variety of criteria, including preferred interests.](https://www.onetonline.org/)   #### O*NET  O*NET offers in-depth information on occupations with a focus on the knowledge, skills, and abilities needed for various positions. You can search careers by a variety of criteria, including preferred interests.   #### Connect majors to careers  With our major-career connection sheets, you will get an overview of each major along with career opportunities, employment options, and links to additional information.   #### Candid Career  Whether you are just beginning to explore major and career options, preparing for a job interview, or looking to change careers, Candid Career can help.   #### Part-time employment  Part-time, relevant work experience allows you to research possible careers, grow skills and experience, build networking connections, and even earn a paycheck.   ### Where are you headed?   #### Self-focus  What are your values, interests, personality, and skills?  What are your values, interests, personality, and skills?   #### Target  Create a short list of majors and careers that match you.  Create a short list of majors and careers that match you.   #### Explore  Narrow down options with written and online resources, real people, and real experience.  Narrow down options with written and online resources, real people, and real experience.   #### Plan and select  Evaluate your findings, make a decision, and set goals.  Evaluate your findings, make a decision, and set goals.   #### Plan and act  Declare your major, plan and continue coursework, get experience, and develop job search tools.  Declare your major, plan and continue coursework, get experience, and develop job search tools.   #### Plan and assess  Evaluate your progress, identify barriers to success, and reassess your goals.  Evaluate your progress, identify barriers to success, and reassess your goals.

## Majors and careers for investigative interests   ### For abstract problem solvers  Majors and careers can be clustered into six broad interest areas that correspond to six different personality types. Based on the research of Dr. John Holland, this clustering system provides a preliminary way to identify undergraduate majors and careers that might be a satisfying fit for you. Because personality, majors, and careers are too complex to be described by a single interest theme, you will see that the lists below have a three-letter code to more accurately describe majors and careers using a combination of related interests (in order of importance). This “investigative” page reflects the interest cluster that ranks the “I” theme first, but be sure to review the other five clusters to see if any of those themes (R, A, S, E, C) are more descriptive of your interests.   ### Am I investigative?  Check off your interests, values, abilities, and qualities to find out.  These are characteristics of the investigative type. Investigative people are intellectual, abstract, analytical, independent, and task oriented. They like to observe, learn, investigate, analyze, evaluate, and solve problems. If this sounds like you, read on. If not, try one of the other five interest clusters.   ### Investigative majors  The following is a small sample of majors an investigative person might find interesting.  [Anthropology](https://indiana.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/msteams_92d57a/EVu2KpCA-aFMq5hEiP80WfABXcc44RSYoQpiXrIINCadxQ?e=7dRBb7) investigative person might choose.  Definitions of the above job titles can be found at O-NET OnLine . For additional investigative majors or careers, consult your academic advisor or a career counselor.  [O-NET OnLine](http://www.onetonline.org/)   ### Selecting an investigative major and career  Selecting a major and career is a very involved process, requiring careful evaluation of yourself as well as academic and occupational information. No single questionnaire, assessment, or person can tell you what you should pursue. In order to make the best choices, it is important to consider your unique combination of interests, values, abilities, personality, and experiences.  Keep in mind that majors and careers can accommodate a wide range of interests; an exact fit is not necessary for academic and career satisfaction. The majors and careers above are suggested only as starting points for your exploration. Specific major and career decisions can be discussed in more detail with your academic advisor or career counselor.   ### More information on careers and advising  [Schools, majors, and careers offered at IUPUI](https://www.iupui.edu/academics/schools.html)  Schools, majors, and careers offered at IUPUI  Check sheets for each IUPUI major  [Course descriptions for IUPUI](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/)  Course descriptions for IUPUI  What can I do with a major I choose? # River Garrett  Student Success Advisor, AHHS Cluster  [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rivergarrett/)  Education:  Professional Experience:  Advice to students: Deep breaths are your best friend. Overwhelmed? Deep breath. Confused? Deep breath. Walked across campus and made it to class in the nick of time with coffee? Deep breath.  If you could be any major in your cluster, what would it be? Why?: While I was an elementary education major, I was also a history minor, so I'd definitely choose that one. I have always loved ancient history, and that's what I specialized in while in college. Anything pre-history to about the early 1800s is my jam!  Biography: I am originally from Decatur Township here in Indianapolis, but I did live in Florida for about eight years before moving back here after college. I am currently a member of Naptown Roller Derby, as well as the Indianapolis Women's Chorus! I personally have six pets, including a Maine Coon mix, three snakes, and two leopard geckos.

## About the art education major  Herron’s art education programs prepare you to teach art in public and private schools, grades K–12. In the diverse settings of Indianapolis schools and museums, you'll learn the reflective practice of teaching young people of all backgrounds to create and to respond to art in today’s world. You'll examine the visual development of young people and construct learning environments where social imagination and visual literacy skills flourish. This major combines classes from Herron and the School of Education.  Skills and abilities this major develops : teaching, curriculum, writing, fine art skills, and cultural competency (Herron School of Art and Design, 2017).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.](https://education.iupui.edu/student-experience/organizations.html)   #### Student organizations  Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.  [Service learning You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning.](https://education.iupui.edu/community-engagement/index.html)   #### Service learning  You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning.  [Study abroad Study abroad is much more than a trip—it’s an intellectual and cultural adventure that will change the way you see the world, other people, and yourself.](https://abroad.iupui.edu/)   #### Study abroad  Study abroad is much more than a trip—it’s an intellectual and cultural adventure that will change the way you see the world, other people, and yourself.   ### Opportunities after graduation   #### Career opportunities  Employment of high school teachers is projected to grow 5% from 2021 to 2031, about as fast as the average for all occupations. About 77,900 openings for high school teachers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary for graduates from the School of Education was $41,859, and the median was $42,830.  The national median annual salary for high school teachers was $61,820 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ).  (This section is intended for informational purposes, not prediction of actual salary.)   #### Graduate and professional school paths  Art education majors often pursue advanced degrees in the following areas:   ### Quick facts   #### Sample coursework   #### Possible careers  *These careers require additional training or education.   #### Where could I work?   ### Complementing interests  A Artistic  E Enterprising  S Social   ### Where to get more information  [IU Herron School of Art and Design](https://herron.iupui.edu/)  IU Herron School of Art and Design  [National Art Education Association (NAEA)](https://www.arteducators.org/)  National Art Education Association (NAEA)  [Herron Career Services](https://herron.iupui.edu/student-life/career-services/index.html)  Herron Career Services   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)   ### Meet with an advisor or career consultant  [Schedule an appointment](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/appointments/index.html)

## About the early childhood education major  This major is designed for early childhood educators interested in developing the skills necessary to effectively empower, engage, and educate diverse learners in a variety of urban education settings, both in the private and public sectors.  As an early childhood education major, you'll learn from experienced faculty, who will prepare you to be a transformative teacher of young children. A variety of course offerings are tailored to support learners working toward professional certification and career advancement.  Skills and abilities this major develops : assessment of children’s knowledge, planning instruction, teaching, problem solving, and addressing issues of equity and other barriers to education in urban communities.   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Student organizations Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.](https://education.iupui.edu/student-experience/organizations.html)   #### Student organizations  Students interested in education tend to be a passionate bunch. We're home to a number of student organizations dedicated to different facets of teaching and education.  [Service learning You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning.](https://education.iupui.edu/community-engagement/index.html)   #### Service learning  You can add to your built-in student teaching experience through community engagement. From service projects to conferences, you get a head start on lifelong learning. About 63,100 openings for preschool teachers are projected each year, on average, over the decade. Many of those openings are expected to result from the need to replace workers who transfer to different occupations or exit the labor force, such as retirement ( Occupational Outlook Handbook , 2022).   #### Salary information  According to the IUPUI First Destination Survey in 2021, the average starting salary reported for School of Education graduates was $41,859, and the median was $42,830.  The national median annual salary for preschool teachers was $30,210 in 2021 ( Occupational Outlook Handbook ). ## About the history major  History teaches us to understand the human social conditions through the systematic study of the human past. As a history major, you'll learn to see and interpret cause and effect and gain experience in research and writing.  A historical perspective enriches any other field of study and serves as an excellent foundation for a wide range of liberal arts graduate programs. The history major courses also provide you a solid basis for professional training in other fields. The history major offers three concentrations: U.S. history, European history, and African/Asian/Latin American history.  Skills and abilities this major develops : critical thinking, strong writing skills, research, public speaking, and problem solving (IU School of Liberal Arts, 2018).   ### Engaged learning experiences  Regardless of your major or future career, engaged learning is vital to your present and future. It makes you more marketable for jobs and professional schools upon graduation, it enables you to build deeper connections with faculty and staff in your field of study, and it makes your learning personal by connecting your interests and values with the curriculum from your classes. Check out the three ideas below for places to get started, or learn more at IUPUI’s Institute for Engaged Learning website.  [Institute for Engaged Learning website.](https://getengaged.iupui.edu/)  [Service learning We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. Each year, our students, faculty, and staff work to improve neighborhoods in Indianapolis and beyond through service learning courses, community-based research and service projects, and partnerships with local organizations. Join us if you want to make a difference.](https://liberalarts.iupui.edu/student-life/service-learning.html)   #### Service learning  We believe in our power and responsibility to help others. ## About the technical communication major  Advances in technology increase the need to communicate complex technical information effectively to a variety of audiences and users. Technical communicators create a range of materials, from user manuals, training guides, and business reports to websites and online help pages.  The Bachelor of Science in Technical Communication provides theory, methods, and skills needed to design, develop, and edit scientific, technical, and business materials. This program offers applied industry projects and internships and includes optional tracks, such as international dimensions, usability, or health care (Purdue School of Engineering and Technology, 2019).  Skills and abilities this major develops: reading and writing skills, critical thinking and problem-solving skills, technical skills, knowledge of graphic design and publishing software, and detail orientation. ## Computer engineering   ### School of Engineering and Technology  Fascinated by computers? How about the hardware, software, and networks that make them run? Computer engineering at IUPUI goes behind the scenes of some of the most influential technology of the day. Learn to combine analytical skills, hardware expertise, and software knowledge to design the computer systems, software, networks, and operating systems that are changing the world as we know it.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible. ## Learn about resources for faculty and staff   ### First-year seminars  When students can articulate their values, interests, personality, and skills in a detailed way and relate those to the world of work, they become more engaged and successful students.   ### Career presentations  Students will be able to identify personal traits and will understand career exploration using information, people resources, and their own experiences.   ### ACD staff tools  FYS authorization form, service indicator clearance, math authorization form, major/certification form, drop/add permissions, workshop summaries, and TPD submission.   ### Resources for Fall Career Week  View event submission information and the promotional tool kit for Fall Career Week.   ### Resources for Spring Career Fair  View information and the promotional tool kit for Spring Career Fair.

## Computer graphics technology   ### School of Engineering and Technology  Computer graphics technology (CGT) at IUPUI educates students to become the finest practitioners, managers, and leaders in the field of applied computer graphics technology and digital communication. Our students are creative and technological problem solvers and are consistently hired for their expertise in both areas.  CGT is a unique program that prepares students for a wide variety of computer graphics professions. So whether you dream of designing robust websites, animating 3D characters, or anything in between, the fun begins with computer graphics technology.   #### Degree map  One of the most difficult tasks of being a college student is figuring out what classes to take and when to take them. In order to make the process a little easier, each major at IUPUI has its own degree map outlining the path you should take to graduate as quickly as possible.  [View degree map](https://sisjee.iu.edu/sisigps-prd/web/igps/dm/public/)   #### Major-career connections  Computer graphics technology   #### Major information  Computer graphics technology  [Computer graphics technology](https://et.iupui.edu/departments/cigt/programs/cgt/)   #### Get admitted to the School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Admission by certification   ##### Home page  [School of Engineering and Technology](http://www.engr.iupui.edu/)   ### Arts, Humanities, and Human Services Cluster  This major is part of the Arts, Humanities, and Human Services (AHHS) cluster. The AHHS cluster is the academic home of University College students pursuing majors in art and design, education, general studies, journalism, liberal arts, and social work. The AHHS cluster partners with students on their academic advising and career plans to guide them into their degree-granting schools.  Learn about the AHHS cluster  [Learn about the AHHS cluster](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/ahhs/index.html)  Learn about other clusters  [Learn about other clusters](https://acd.iupui.edu/advising/advisors-and-clusters/index.html)
